}>`} - * `loaded-changed` {`CustomEvent<{ value: any; }>`} - * `zoom` {`CustomEvent<{ value: any; }>`} - * `page` {`CustomEvent<{ value: any; }>`} - * `pan` {`CustomEvent<{ value: any; }>`} - * `update-viewport` {`CustomEvent<{ value: any; }>`} - * `viewport-changed` {`CustomEvent<{ value: any; }>`} - Attributes: * `src` {`string`} - image source * `sources` {`any[]`} - array of image sources * `described-by` {`string`} - aria-describedby attribute * `loaded` {`boolean`} - loaded * `navigator-top` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", top position for navigator * `navigator-bottom` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", bottom position for navigator * `navigator-left` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", left position for navigator * `navigator-right` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", right position for navigator * `navigator-height` {`string`} - height of navigator * `navigator-width` {`string`} - width of navigator * `previousButton` {`string`} - id of custom previousButton * `nextButton` {`string`} - id of custom nextButton * `homeButton` {`string`} - id of custom homeButton * `zoomInButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `zoomOutButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `fullScreenButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `page` {`number`} - if used with multiple images and paged navigation, index of current item * `loading` {`boolean`} - loading * `dzi` {`boolean`} - Set to true if you are using a deep zoom image * `fade-in` {`boolean`} - Fade in new items added to the viewer * `hide-spinner` {`boolean`} - hides spinner * `fullscreen-toggled` {`boolean`} - whether fullscreen mode is toggled * `flip-toggled` {`boolean`} - whether images is flipped horizontally * `show-navigation-control` {`boolean`} - Set to false to prevent the appearance of the default navigation controls. Note that if set to false, the customs buttons set by the options zoomInButton, zoomOutButton etc, are rendered inactive. * `show-navigator` {`boolean`} - Set to true to make the navigator minimap appear. * `navigator-auto-fade` {`boolean`} - whether navigator fades when image is not longer being moved * `navigator-position` {`string`} - where navigator is positioned: "TOP_LEFT", "BOTTOM_RIGHT", "ABSOLUTE", etc. Default is "TOP_RIGHT" * `navigator-toggled` {`boolean`} - whether navigator window mode is toggled * `zoom-per-click` {`number`} - The "zoom distance" per mouse click or touch tap. Note: Setting this to 1.0 effectively disables the click-to-zoom feature (also see gestureSettings[Mouse|Touch|Pen].clickToZoom/dblClickToZoom). * `zoom-per-scroll` {`number`} - The "zoom distance" per mouse scroll or touch pinch. Note: Setting this to 1.0 effectively disables the mouse-wheel zoom feature (also see gestureSettings[Mouse|Touch|Pen].scrollToZoom}). * `animation-time` {`number`} - Specifies the animation duration per each OpenSeadragon.Spring which occur when the image is dragged or zoomed. * `nav-prev-next-wrap` {`boolean`} - If true then the 'previous' button will wrap to the last image when viewing the first image and the 'next' button will wrap to the first image when viewing the last image. * `show-rotation-control` {`boolean`} - If true then the rotate left/right controls will be displayed as part of the standard controls. This is also subject to the browser support for rotate (e.g. viewer.drawer.canRotate()). * `min-zoom-image-ratio` {`number`} - The minimum percentage ( expressed as a number between 0 and 1 ) of the viewport height or width at which the zoom out will be constrained. Setting it to 0, for example will allow you to zoom out infinity. * `max-zoom-pixel-ratio` {`number`} - The maximum ratio to allow a zoom-in to affect the highest level pixel ratio. This can be set to Infinity to allow 'infinite' zooming into the image though it is less effective visually if the HTML5 Canvas is not availble on the viewing device. * `constrain-during-pan` {`boolean`} - Constrain during pan * `visibility-ratio` {`number`} - The percentage ( as a number from 0 to 1 ) of the source image which must be kept within the viewport. If the image is dragged beyond that limit, it will 'bounce' back until the minimum visibility ratio is achieved. Setting this to 0 and wrapHorizontal ( or wrapVertical ) to true will provide the effect of an infinitely scrolling viewport. * `sequence-mode` {`boolean`} - displays multiple images as a sequence * `preserve-viewport` {`boolean`} - preserves viewport when navigating images in sequence mode See https://openseadragon.github.io/examples/tilesource-sequence/ * `show-reference-strip` {`boolean`} - show reference strip for images in sequence mode. See https://openseadragon.github.io/examples/ui-reference-strip/ * `reference-strip-scroll` {`string`} - orientation of images using reference strip; can be 'horizontal' or 'vertical' (default) Properties: * `src` {`string`} - image source * `sources` {`any[]`} - array of image sources * `describedBy` {`string`} - aria-describedby attribute * `loaded` {`boolean`} - loaded * `navigatorTop` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", top position for navigator * `navigatorBottom` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", bottom position for navigator * `navigatorLeft` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", left position for navigator * `navigatorRight` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", right position for navigator * `navigatorHeight` {`string`} - height of navigator * `navigatorWidth` {`string`} - width of navigator * `previousButton` {`string`} - id of custom previousButton * `nextButton` {`string`} - id of custom nextButton * `homeButton` {`string`} - id of custom homeButton * `zoomInButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `zoomOutButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `fullScreenButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `windowControllers` - * `page` {`number`} - if used with multiple images and paged navigation, index of current item * `loading` {`boolean`} - loading * `dzi` {`boolean`} - Set to true if you are using a deep zoom image * `fadeIn` {`boolean`} - Fade in new items added to the viewer * `hideSpinner` {`boolean`} - hides spinner * `fullscreenToggled` {`boolean`} - whether fullscreen mode is toggled * `flipToggled` {`boolean`} - whether images is flipped horizontally * `showNavigationControl` {`boolean`} - Set to false to prevent the appearance of the default navigation controls. Note that if set to false, the customs buttons set by the options zoomInButton, zoomOutButton etc, are rendered inactive. * `showNavigator` {`boolean`} - Set to true to make the navigator minimap appear. * `navigatorAutoFade` {`boolean`} - whether navigator fades when image is not longer being moved * `navigatorPosition` {`string`} - where navigator is positioned: "TOP_LEFT", "BOTTOM_RIGHT", "ABSOLUTE", etc. Default is "TOP_RIGHT" * `navigatorToggled` {`boolean`} - whether navigator window mode is toggled * `zoomPerClick` {`number`} - The "zoom distance" per mouse click or touch tap. Note: Setting this to 1.0 effectively disables the click-to-zoom feature (also see gestureSettings[Mouse|Touch|Pen].clickToZoom/dblClickToZoom). * `zoomPerScroll` {`number`} - The "zoom distance" per mouse scroll or touch pinch. Note: Setting this to 1.0 effectively disables the mouse-wheel zoom feature (also see gestureSettings[Mouse|Touch|Pen].scrollToZoom}). * `animationTime` {`number`} - Specifies the animation duration per each OpenSeadragon.Spring which occur when the image is dragged or zoomed. * `navPrevNextWrap` {`boolean`} - If true then the 'previous' button will wrap to the last image when viewing the first image and the 'next' button will wrap to the first image when viewing the last image. * `showRotationControl` {`boolean`} - If true then the rotate left/right controls will be displayed as part of the standard controls. This is also subject to the browser support for rotate (e.g. viewer.drawer.canRotate()). * `minZoomImageRatio` {`number`} - The minimum percentage ( expressed as a number between 0 and 1 ) of the viewport height or width at which the zoom out will be constrained. Setting it to 0, for example will allow you to zoom out infinity. * `maxZoomPixelRatio` {`number`} - The maximum ratio to allow a zoom-in to affect the highest level pixel ratio. This can be set to Infinity to allow 'infinite' zooming into the image though it is less effective visually if the HTML5 Canvas is not availble on the viewing device. * `constrainDuringPan` {`boolean`} - Constrain during pan * `visibilityRatio` {`number`} - The percentage ( as a number from 0 to 1 ) of the source image which must be kept within the viewport. If the image is dragged beyond that limit, it will 'bounce' back until the minimum visibility ratio is achieved. Setting this to 0 and wrapHorizontal ( or wrapVertical ) to true will provide the effect of an infinitely scrolling viewport. * `sequenceMode` {`boolean`} - displays multiple images as a sequence * `preserveViewport` {`boolean`} - preserves viewport when navigating images in sequence mode See https://openseadragon.github.io/examples/tilesource-sequence/ * `showReferenceStrip` {`boolean`} - show reference strip for images in sequence mode. See https://openseadragon.github.io/examples/ui-reference-strip/ * `referenceStripScroll` {`string`} - orientation of images using reference strip; can be 'horizontal' or 'vertical' (default)

tags.name: img-view-modal
tags.description:
`img-view-modal`
Combines img-pan-zoom and simple-modal for an easy image zoom solution

### Styling

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--img-view-modal-width` | sets width of modal | 90%
`--img-view-modal-height` | sets height of modal | 90vh
`--img-view-modal-backgroundColor` | background color | white
`--img-view-modal-color` | text color | black
`--img-view-modal-borderColor` | border color | #ddd
`--img-view-modal-toggled-backgroundColor` | background color of toggled buttons and kbd commands | #eee

Events:

  * `modal-button-click` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `simple-modal-show` {`CustomEvent<{ title: string | boolean; elements: { content: HTMLElement; }; styles: { "--simple-modal-width": string; "--simple-modal-height": string; "--simple-modal-titlebar-height": string; ... 7 more ...; "--simple-modal-buttons-padding": string; }; invokedBy: this; clone: boolean; }>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `title` {`string`} - 

  * `modal` - 

Properties:

  * `title` {`string`} - 

  * `modal` -

type: string; contents: UncompiledTemplateResult<1>; }`} - * `defaultToolbars` - default toolbar config object, where "top" contains config for toolbar above image(s), and "bottom" contains config for toolbar above image(s) * `loadSrc` - * `__screenfullLoaded` {`boolean`} - * `fullscreenTarget` - element to make fullscreen, can be overidden * `fullscreen` {`boolean`} - * `fullscreenEnabled` {`boolean`} - * `onfullscreenchange` - * `src` - image source * `sources` - array of image sources * `describedBy` {`string`} - aria-describedby attribute * `loaded` {`boolean`} - loaded * `navigatorTop` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", top position for navigator * `navigatorBottom` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", bottom position for navigator * `navigatorLeft` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", left position for navigator * `navigatorRight` {`string`} - if navigator position is "ABSOLUTE", right position for navigator * `navigatorHeight` {`string`} - height of navigator * `navigatorWidth` {`string`} - width of navigator * `previousButton` {`string`} - id of custom previousButton * `nextButton` {`string`} - id of custom nextButton * `homeButton` {`string`} - id of custom homeButton * `zoomInButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `zoomOutButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `fullScreenButton` {`string`} - id of custom zoomInButton * `windowControllers` - * `page` {`number`} - if used with multiple images and paged navigation, index of current item * `loading` {`boolean`} - loading * `dzi` {`boolean`} - Set to true if you are using a deep zoom image * `fadeIn` {`boolean`} - Fade in new items added to the viewer * `hideSpinner` {`boolean`} - hides spinner * `fullscreenToggled` {`boolean`} - whether fullscreen mode is toggled * `flipToggled` {`boolean`} - whether images is flipped horizontally * `showNavigationControl` {`boolean`} - Set to false to prevent the appearance of the default navigation controls. Note that if set to false, the customs buttons set by the options zoomInButton, zoomOutButton etc, are rendered inactive. * `showNavigator` {`boolean`} - Set to true to make the navigator minimap appear. * `navigatorAutoFade` {`boolean`} - whether navigator fades when image is not longer being moved * `navigatorPosition` {`string`} - where navigator is positioned: "TOP_LEFT", "BOTTOM_RIGHT", "ABSOLUTE", etc. Default is "TOP_RIGHT" * `navigatorToggled` {`boolean`} - whether navigator window mode is toggled * `zoomPerClick` {`number`} - The "zoom distance" per mouse click or touch tap. Note: Setting this to 1.0 effectively disables the click-to-zoom feature (also see gestureSettings[Mouse|Touch|Pen].clickToZoom/dblClickToZoom). * `zoomPerScroll` {`number`} - The "zoom distance" per mouse scroll or touch pinch. Note: Setting this to 1.0 effectively disables the mouse-wheel zoom feature (also see gestureSettings[Mouse|Touch|Pen].scrollToZoom}). * `animationTime` {`number`} - Specifies the animation duration per each OpenSeadragon.Spring which occur when the image is dragged or zoomed. * `navPrevNextWrap` {`boolean`} - If true then the 'previous' button will wrap to the last image when viewing the first image and the 'next' button will wrap to the first image when viewing the last image. * `showRotationControl` {`boolean`} - If true then the rotate left/right controls will be displayed as part of the standard controls. This is also subject to the browser support for rotate (e.g. viewer.drawer.canRotate()). * `minZoomImageRatio` {`number`} - The minimum percentage ( expressed as a number between 0 and 1 ) of the viewport height or width at which the zoom out will be constrained. Setting it to 0, for example will allow you to zoom out infinity. * `maxZoomPixelRatio` {`number`} - The maximum ratio to allow a zoom-in to affect the highest level pixel ratio. This can be set to Infinity to allow 'infinite' zooming into the image though it is less effective visually if the HTML5 Canvas is not availble on the viewing device. * `constrainDuringPan` {`boolean`} - Constrain during pan * `visibilityRatio` {`number`} - The percentage ( as a number from 0 to 1 ) of the source image which must be kept within the viewport. If the image is dragged beyond that limit, it will 'bounce' back until the minimum visibility ratio is achieved. Setting this to 0 and wrapHorizontal ( or wrapVertical ) to true will provide the effect of an infinitely scrolling viewport. * `sequenceMode` {`boolean`} - displays multiple images as a sequence * `preserveViewport` {`boolean`} - preserves viewport when navigating images in sequence mode See https://openseadragon.github.io/examples/tilesource-sequence/ * `showReferenceStrip` {`boolean`} - show reference strip for images in sequence mode. See https://openseadragon.github.io/examples/ui-reference-strip/ * `referenceStripScroll` {`string`} - orientation of images using reference strip; can be 'horizontal' or 'vertical' (default)

`inline-audio`
`A simple inline audio player to augment text`

### Styling

::part()
The following parts are available for styling:
icon - the icon
progress - the progress bar
progress-bar - the progress bar container

  * `source` {`string`} - Original Source of the work in question

  * `more-label` {`string`} - More details label

tags.name: lrn-icon
tags.description:
The `lrn-icon` element displays an icon. By default an icon renders as a 24px square.

Example using src:

<lrn-icon src="star.png"></lrn-icon>

Example setting size to 32px x 32px:

<lrn-icon class="big" src="big_star.png"></lrn-icon>

<style>
   .big {
     --lrn-icon-height: 32px;
     --lrn-icon-width: 32px;
   }
</style>

The iron elements include several sets of icons.
To use the default set of icons, import `lrn-icons.html` and use the `icon` attribute to specify an icon:

<link rel="import" href="/components/lrn-icons/lrn-icons.html">

<lrn-icon icon="menu"></lrn-icon>

To use a different built-in set of icons, import the specific `lrn-icons/<iconset>-icons.html`, and
specify the icon as `<iconset>:<icon>`. For example, to use a communication icon, you would
use:

<link rel="import" href="/components/lrn-icons/communication-icons.html">

<lrn-icon icon="communication:email"></lrn-icon>

You can also create custom icon sets of bitmap or SVG icons.

Example of using an icon named `cherry` from a custom iconset with the ID `fruit`:

<lrn-icon icon="fruit:cherry"></lrn-icon>

See [lrn-iconset](lrn-iconset) and [lrn-iconset-svg](lrn-iconset-svg) for more information about
how to create a custom iconset.

See the [lrn-icons demo](lrn-icons?view=demo:demo/index.html) to see the icons available
in the various iconsets.

To load a subset of icons from one of the default `lrn-icons` sets, you can
use the [poly-icon](https://poly-icon.appspot.com/) tool. It allows you
to select individual icons, and creates an iconset from them that you can
use directly in your elements.

### Styling

The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--lrn-icon` | Mixin applied to the icon | {}
`--lrn-icon-width` | Width of the icon | `24px`
`--lrn-icon-height` | Height of the icon | `24px`
`--lrn-icon-fill-color` | Fill color of the svg icon | `currentcolor`
`--lrn-icon-stroke-color` | Stroke color of the svg icon | none

Attributes:

  * `icon` {`string`} - The name of the icon to use. The name should be of the form:
`iconset_name:icon_name`.

  * `theme` {`string`} - The name of the theme to used, if one is specified by the
iconset.

  * `src` {`string`} - If using lrn-icon without an iconset, you can set the src to be
the URL of an individual icon image file. Note that this will take
precedence over a given icon attribute.

  * `_meta` - 

Properties:

  * `icon` {`string`} - The name of the icon to use. The name should be of the form:
`iconset_name:icon_name`.

  * `src` {`string`} - If using lrn-icon without an iconset, you can set the src to be

### Styling

----------------|-------------|----------

  * `allow-grey` {`boolean`} - allow grey instead of accent color, default selects a color

  * `two-chars` {`boolean`} - Mode for presenting 1st two letters

  * `jdenticon` {`boolean`} - Form abstract art from hash of label

  * `label` {`string`} - text to use for avatar

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - a selected accent-"color": grey, red, pink, purple, etc.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - make the default theme dark?

tags.name: lrndesign-bar
tags.description:
`lrndesign-bar` a bar chart Events: * `chartist-render-ready` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once once chart is ready. * `chart-data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when chartData changes * `data-source-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data-source changes * `data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data changes * `chartist-render-data` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired when chart is rendering. * `chartist-render-created` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once chart is created features are added. * `chartist-render-draw` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired as shapes are being drawn. Attributes: * `axis-x-only-integer` {`boolean`} - Use only integer values (whole numbers) for the scale steps * `axis-x-min-space` {`number`} - TODO * `distribute-series` {`boolean`} - If set to true then each bar will represent a series and the data array is expected to be a one dimensional array of data values rather than a series array of series. This is useful if the bar chart should represent a profile rather than some data over time. * `horizontal-bars` {`boolean`} - Inverts the axes of the bar chart in order to draw a horizontal bar chart. Be aware that you also need to invert your axis settings as the Y Axis will now display the labels and the X Axis the values. * `reference-value` {`number`} - Unless low/high are explicitly set, bar chart will be centered at zero by default. Set referenceValue to null to auto scale. * `series-bar-distance` {`number`} - Specify the distance in pixel of bars in a group. * `stack-bars` {`boolean`} - If set to true this property will cause the series bars to be stacked. Check the "stackMode" option for further stacking options. * `stack-mode` {`boolean`} - If set to "true" this property will form a total for each series point. This will also influence the y-axis and the overall bounds of the chart. If set to "false" this property will force the stacked bars to draw from the zero line. In stacked mode the "seriesBarDistance" property will have no effect. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverse-data` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `chart-title` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chart-data` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chart-desc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsive-options` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. attributes.name: full-width
attributes.description:
`full-width` {`boolean`} - When set to true, the last grid line on the x-axis
is not drawn and the chart elements will expand
to the full available width of the chart.
For the last label to be drawn correctly
you might need to add chart padding or offset the
last label with a draw event handler.

Property: fullWidth

attributes.name: line-smooth
attributes.description:
`line-smooth` {`boolean`} - Specify if the lines should be smoothed.
This value can be true or false where true
will result in smoothing using the default
smoothing interpolation function Chartist.
Interpolation.cardinal and false results in
Chartist.Interpolation.none.
You can also choose other smoothing /
interpolation functions available in the Chartist.
Interpolation module, or write your own
interpolation function. Check the examples
for a brief description..

Property: lineSmooth

tags.name: lrndesign-pie
tags.description:
`lrndesign-pie` a pie chart Events: * `chartist-render-ready` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once once chart is ready. * `chart-data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when chartData changes * `data-source-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data-source changes * `data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data changes * `chartist-render-data` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired when chart is rendering. * `chartist-render-created` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once chart is created features are added. * `chartist-render-draw` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired as shapes are being drawn. Attributes: * `chartPadding` {`number`} - Padding of chart drawing area to container element and labels * `donut` {`boolean`} - Displays chart as donut instead of pie. * `donutSolid` {`boolean`} - Draw donut segments as shapes instead of strokes. * `donutWidth` {`number`} - Donut stroke width, currently done in javascript. * `ignoreEmptyValues` {`boolean`} - Empty values will be ignored to avoid drawing unncessary slices and labels * `labelDirection` {`string`} - Label direction can be 'neutral', 'explode' or 'implode'. The labels anchor will be positioned based on those settings as well as the fact if the labels are on the right or left side of the center of the chart. Usually explode is useful when labels are positioned far away from the center. * `labelOffset` {`number`} - Label position offset from the standard position which is half distance of the radius. This value can be either positive or negative. Positive values will position the label away from the center. * `label-position` {`string`} - This option can be set to 'inside', 'outside' or 'center'. Positioned with 'inside' the labels will be placed on half the distance of the radius to the border of the Pie by respecting the 'labelOffset'. The 'outside' option will place the labels at the border of the pie and 'center' will place the labels in the absolute center point of the chart. The 'center' option only makes sense in conjunction with the 'labelOffset' option. * `showLabel` {`boolean`} - If a label should be shown. * `startAngle` {`number`} - Start angle of the pie chart in degrees where 0 points north. A higher value offsets the start angle clockwise.. * `total` {`number`} - Optional total you can specify. By specifying a total value, the sum of the values in the series must be this total in order to draw a full pie. You can use this parameter to draw only parts of a pie or gauge charts. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverse-data` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `chart-title` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chart-data` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chart-desc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsive-options` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........

.ct-minor-second	  15:16
.ct-major-second	  8:9
.ct-minor-third	    5:6
.ct-major-third	    4:5
.ct-perfect-fourth	3:4
.ct-perfect-fifth	  2:3
.ct-minor-sixth	    5:8
.ct-golden-section	1:1.618
.ct-major-sixth	    3:5
.ct-minor-seventh	  9:16
.ct-major-seventh	  8:15
.ct-octave	        1:2
.ct-major-tenth	    2:5
.ct-major-eleventh	3:8
.ct-major-twelfth	  1:3
.ct-double-octave	  1:4```

Property: scale

Default: ct-minor-seventh

tags.name: lrndesign-timeline
tags.description:
`lrndesign-timeline`
`an element that displays events on a timeline`

Events:

  * `responsive-element` {`CustomEvent<{ element: this; attribute: string; relativeToParent: boolean; sm: number; md: number; lg: number; xl: number; }>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `events` {`any[]`} - the events of the timeline, in the desired order, as in:```
[
{
"heading": "1855 - Penn State Charter",   //required, the main heading for the media, usually a date, time, or era
"details": "",                            //optional, text describing the event
"image": {                                //optional image for the event
  "src": "path/to/media.jpg",             //the alt text of the image
  "alt": "path/to/media.mp3",             //the url of the image
},
{...},
{...},
}
]```

  * `timeline-size` {`string`} - the timline size, calculated by responsive utility

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - a selected accent-"color": grey, red, pink, purple, etc.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - make the default theme dark?

Properties:

  * `eventsElement` - events container element

  * `eventsList` - ensures that events list is an Array

  * `observer` - mutation observer for tabs

  * `events` {`any[]`} - the events of the timeline, in the desired order, as in:```
[
{
"heading": "1855 - Penn State Charter",   //required, the main heading for the media, usually a date, time, or era
"details": "",                            //optional, text describing the event
"image": {                                //optional image for the event
  "src": "path/to/media.jpg",             //the alt text of the image
  "alt": "path/to/media.mp3",             //the url of the image
},
{...},
{...},
}
]```

  * `timelineSize` {`string`} - the timline size, calculated by responsive utility

  * `accentColor` {`string`} - a selected accent-"color": grey, red, pink, purple, etc.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - make the default theme dark?

  * `colors` -

tags.name: nav-card-item
tags.description:
`nav-card-item`
links fr the nav card
### Styling

`<nav-card-item>` provides the following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--nav-card-item-background-color` | item's default background-color | unset
`--nav-card-item-color` | item's default teext color | unset
`--nav-card-item-label-font-weight` | item's default font-weight | bold
`--nav-card-linklist-border-bottom` | item's border-bottom | 1px solid var(--simple-colors-default-theme-grey-4)
`--nav-card-item-label-font-size` | item's default font-size | inherit
`--nav-card-item-label-font-weight` | item's default font-weight | bold
`--nav-card-item-label-font-size` | item description's default font-weight | 11px
`--nav-card-item-label-font-weight` | item description's default font-wight | normal
`--nav-card-item-avatar-size` | default size for item's avatar | 36px
`--nav-card-item-avatar-width` | default width for item's avatar | --nav-card-item-avatar-size
`--nav-card-item-avatar-height` | default height for item's avatar | --nav-card-item-avatar-size
`--nav-card-item-icon-size` | default size for item's icon | 24px
`--nav-card-item-icon-width` | default width for item's icon | --nav-card-item-icon-size
`--nav-card-item-icon-height` | default height for item's icon | --nav-card-item-icon-size

Attributes:

  * `avatar` {`string`} - optional simple-icon or image URI as avatar on left of link

  * `icon` {`string`} - simple-icon on right of link

  * `initials` {`string`} - optional use up to two initials if no avatar

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - optional accent-color for avatar

  * `allow-grey` {`boolean`} - allow grey instead of accent color, default selects a color

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - optional dark text for avatar icon

  * `invert` {`boolean`} - invert icon coloring

Properties:

  * `avatar` {`string`} - optional simple-icon or image URI as avatar on left of link

  * `icon` {`string`} - simple-icon on right of link

  * `initials` {`string`} - optional use up to two initials if no avatar

  * `twoChars` {`boolean`} - gets the avatar icon

  * `label` - gets the avatar icon

  * `ico` - gets the avatar icon

  * `src` - gets the avatar src

  * `tag` {`string`} - 

  * `accentColor` {`string`} - optional accent-color for avatar

  * `allowGrey` {`boolean`} - allow grey instead of accent color, default selects a color

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - optional dark text for avatar icon

  * `invert` {`boolean`} - invert icon coloring

tags.name: nav-card
tags.description:
`nav-card`
an accent card of link lists

Attributes:

  * `icon-size` {`string`} - 

  * `image-width` {`string`} - 

  * `accent-background` {`boolean`} - Apply accent color to card background

  * `accent-heading` {`boolean`} - Apply accent color to heading

  * `flat` {`boolean`} - Display card as flat (no box shadow);

  * `horizontal` {`boolean`} - Display card as a horizontal layout? Default is vertical.

  * `image-align` {`string`} - "Optional": Horizontal alignment of image, so that:
- "left" will align left edge of image.
- "right" will align right edge of image.
- "center" will align center of image
- A null will allow temporary support to deprecated CSS variables

  * `image-src` {`string`} - "Optional": source for an image on card

  * `image-valign` {`string`} - "Optional": vertical alignment of image, so that:
- "top" will align top of edge of image.
- "bottom" will align bottom edge of image.
- "center" will align middle of image.
- A null will allow temporary support to deprecated CSS variables

  * `no-border` {`boolean`} - Removes think accent border

  * `ready` {`boolean`} - 

  * `link` {`string`} - 

  * `element-visible` {`boolean`} - 

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - a selected accent-"color": grey, red, pink, purple, etc.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - make the default theme dark?

Properties:

  * `tag` {`string`} - 

  * `iconSize` {`string`} -

  * `accentHeading` {`boolean`} - Apply accent color to heading

  * `flat` {`boolean`} - Display card as flat (no box shadow);

  * `horizontal` {`boolean`} - Display card as a horizontal layout? Default is vertical.

  * `imageAlign` {`string`} - "Optional": Horizontal alignment of image, so that:
- "left" will align left edge of image.
- "right" will align right edge of image.
- "center" will align center of image
- A null will allow temporary support to deprecated CSS variables

  * `imageSrc` {`string`} - "Optional": source for an image on card

  * `imageValign` {`string`} - "Optional": vertical alignment of image, so that:
- "top" will align top of edge of image.
- "bottom" will align bottom edge of image.
- "center" will align middle of image.
- A null will allow temporary support to deprecated CSS variables

  * `noBorder` {`boolean`} - Removes think accent border

  * `ready` {`boolean`} - 

  * `link` {`string`} - 

  * `icon` {`string`} - 

  * `elementVisible` {`boolean`} - 

  * `IOThresholds` {`number[]`} - 

  * `IORootMargin` {`string`} - 

  * `IOVisibleLimit` {`number`} - 

  * `IORemoveOnVisible` {`boolean`} - 

  * `IODelay` {`number`} -

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - make the default theme dark?

  * `colors` -

tags.name: paper-avatar
tags.description:
`paper-avatar`
User avatar in material style

### Styling
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-avatar-width` | Size (width and height) of the avatar image | 40px
`--paper-avatar-color` | Background color of the avatar image | `--paper-avatar-calculated-bg`
`--paper-avatar-text-color` | Text color of the avatar image | #fff
`--paper-avatar-calculated-bg` | Do NOT use. Thi is an automatically set variable that can be overriden `--paper-avatar-color` | #000

Attributes:

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - Optional simple-icon

  * `icon` {`string`} - Optional simple-icon

  * `colors` {`any[]`} - Array of colors for avatar background

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - dark mode

  * `label` {`string`} - Label with username

  * `src` {`string`} - Image address or base64

  * `jdenticonExists` {`boolean`} - Ensure we can support jdenticon before invoking it

  * `two-chars` {`boolean`} - Show two chars in avatar

  * `jdenticon` {`boolean`} - Set true if you want use a jdenticon avatar

Properties:

  * `accentColor` {`string`} - Optional simple-icon

  * `icon` {`string`} - Optional simple-icon

  * `colors` {`any[]`} - Array of colors for avatar background

  * `windowControllers` - 

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - dark mode

  * `label` {`string`} - Label with username

  * `src` {`string`} - Image address or base64

  * `jdenticonExists` {`boolean`} - Ensure we can support jdenticon before invoking it

  * `twoChars` {`boolean`} - Show two chars in avatar

  * `jdenticon` {`boolean`} - Set true if you want use a jdenticon avatar

tags.name: paper-search-panel
tags.description:
Events:

  * `change-request-params` {`CustomEvent<boolean>`} - 

  * `search` {`CustomEvent<boolean>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `search` {`string`} - Query for which the user was searching

  * `filters` - All filters from which the user can choose

  * `selected-filters` - All filters that have been selected by the user, e.g. `{ age: [ "child", "teen" ] }`

  * `items` {`any[]`} - Items that are currently shown in the lister

  * `has-more` {`boolean`} - True if further items could be loaded

  * `loading` {`boolean`} - True if items are currently loaded

  * `hide-filter-button` {`boolean`} - Whether to hide the Filter button. Set attribute "hide-filter-button" to do so.

  * `count` {`number`} - Number of items loaded per page (i.e. for each click on [more])

  * `icon` {`string`} - Icon shown in the search background

  * `placeholder` {`string`} - Text shown in the search box if the user didn't enter any query

  * `no-results-text` {`string`} - Text shown if no results are found. Use this property to localize the element.

  * `more-button` {`string`} - Text for the more button to load more data. Use this property to localize the element.

  * `reset-button` {`string`} - Text for the reset button in the filter dialog. Use this property to localize the element.

  * `save-button` {`string`} - Text for the save button in the filter dialog. Use this property to localize the element.

  * `no-values-label` {`string`} - Label shown if no values are selected for a filter. Use this property to localize the element.

  * `_has-items` {`boolean`} - 

Properties:

  * `search` {`string`} - Query for which the user was searching

  * `filters` - All filters from which the user can choose

tags.name: pdf-browser-viewer
tags.description:
Example:
```html
<pdf-browser-viewer id="pdfViewer" file="[[pdfUrl]]" width="100%"></pdf-browser-viewer>
```

Data Bind with Blob example:
```js
this.pdfUrl = URL.createObjectURL(blob);
```

Clear PDF container example:
```js
this.shadowRoot.querySelector('#pdfViewer').clear();
```

Message example:
```html
<pdf-browser-viewer
  file="[[pdfUrl]]"
  not-supported-message="Not supported by your browser"
  not-supported-link-message="see the file here!">
</pdf-browser-viewer>
```

Card example:
```html
<pdf-browser-viewer
  file="[[pdfUrl]]"
  card elevation="3"
  download-label="Baixar">
</pdf-browser-viewer>
```

Attributes:

  * `file` {`string`} - The location of the PDF file.

  * `not-supported-message` {`string`} - The message when browser doesn't support pdf object

  * `not-supported-link-message` {`string`} - The PDF link message when browser doesn't support pdf object

  * `height` {`string`} - The height of the PDF viewer.

  * `width` {`string`} - The width of the PDF viewer.

  * `card` {`boolean`} - PDF viewer as a card with download button.

  * `download-label` {`string`} - Download button label.

  * `elevation` {`string`} - The z-depth of the card, from 0-5.

Properties:

  * `file` {`string`} - The location of the PDF file.

  * `notSupportedMessage` {`string`} - The message when browser doesn't support pdf object

  * `notSupportedLinkMessage` {`string`} - The PDF link message when browser doesn't support pdf object

  * `height` {`string`} - The height of the PDF viewer.

  * `width` {`string`} - The width of the PDF viewer.

  * `card` {`boolean`} - PDF viewer as a card with download button.

  * `downloadLabel` {`string`} - Download button label.

  * `elevation` {`string`} - The z-depth of the card, from 0-5.

  * `_template` {`HTMLTemplateElement | null`} - 

  * `_importPath` {`string`} - 

  * `rootPath` {`string`} - 

  * `importPath` {`string`} - 

  * `root` {`HTMLElement | ShadowRoot | StampedTemplate | null`} - 

  * `$` - 

  * `_overrideLegacyUndefined` {`boolean`} - 

  * `PROPERTY_EFFECT_TYPES` -

`progress-donut` Events: * `chartist-render-ready` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once once chart is ready. * `chart-data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when chartData changes * `data-source-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data-source changes * `data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data changes * `chartist-render-data` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired when chart is rendering. * `chartist-render-created` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once chart is created features are added. * `chartist-render-draw` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired as shapes are being drawn. Attributes: * `animation` {`number`} - Timing for animation or -1 for false * `animation-delay` {`number`} - Timing for animation or 0 none * `complete` {`any[]`} - An array of completed values * `desc` {`string`} - Accessible long description * `image-src` {`string`} - Source of image in the center of the object. * `image-alt` {`string`} - Alt text for image. * `chartPadding` {`number`} - Padding of chart drawing area to container element and labels * `donut` {`boolean`} - Displays chart as donut instead of pie. * `donutSolid` {`boolean`} - Draw donut segments as shapes instead of strokes. * `donutWidth` {`number`} - Donut stroke width, currently done in javascript. * `ignoreEmptyValues` {`boolean`} - Empty values will be ignored to avoid drawing unncessary slices and labels * `labelDirection` {`string`} - Label direction can be 'neutral', 'explode' or 'implode'. The labels anchor will be positioned based on those settings as well as the fact if the labels are on the right or left side of the center of the chart. Usually explode is useful when labels are positioned far away from the center. * `labelOffset` {`number`} - Label position offset from the standard position which is half distance of the radius. This value can be either positive or negative. Positive values will position the label away from the center. * `label-position` {`string`} - This option can be set to 'inside', 'outside' or 'center'. Positioned with 'inside' the labels will be placed on half the distance of the radius to the border of the Pie by respecting the 'labelOffset'. The 'outside' option will place the labels at the border of the pie and 'center' will place the labels in the absolute center point of the chart. The 'center' option only makes sense in conjunction with the 'labelOffset' option. * `showLabel` {`boolean`} - If a label should be shown. * `startAngle` {`number`} - Start angle of the pie chart in degrees where 0 points north. A higher value offsets the start angle clockwise.. * `total` {`number`} - Optional total you can specify. By specifying a total value, the sum of the values in the series must be this total in order to draw a full pie. You can use this parameter to draw only parts of a pie or gauge charts. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverse-data` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `chart-title` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chart-data` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chart-desc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsive-options` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........
label 1
1
DEPRECATED Method: { labels: ["label 1", "label 2", "label 3"] series: [ [1,2,3], [4,5,6] ] } * `data-source` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `show-table` {`boolean`} - The show data in table form as well? Default is false. * `accent-color` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `dark` {`boolean`} - Location of the CSV file. Properties: * `donutData` - * `donutLabels` - * `donutTotal` {`number`} - * `animation` {`number`} - Timing for animation or -1 for false * `animationDelay` {`number`} - Timing for animation or 0 none * `complete` {`any[]`} - An array of completed values * `desc` {`string`} - Accessible long description * `imageSrc` {`string`} - Source of image in the center of the object. * `imageAlt` {`string`} - Alt text for image. * `chartPadding` {`number`} - Padding of chart drawing area to container element and labels * `donut` {`boolean`} - Displays chart as donut instead of pie. * `donutSolid` {`boolean`} - Draw donut segments as shapes instead of strokes. * `donutWidth` {`number`} - Donut stroke width, currently done in javascript. * `ignoreEmptyValues` {`boolean`} - Empty values will be ignored to avoid drawing unncessary slices and labels * `labelDirection` {`string`} - Label direction can be 'neutral', 'explode' or 'implode'. The labels anchor will be positioned based on those settings as well as the fact if the labels are on the right or left side of the center of the chart. Usually explode is useful when labels are positioned far away from the center. * `labelOffset` {`number`} - Label position offset from the standard position which is half distance of the radius. This value can be either positive or negative. Positive values will position the label away from the center. * `labelPosition` {`string`} - This option can be set to 'inside', 'outside' or 'center'. Positioned with 'inside' the labels will be placed on half the distance of the radius to the border of the Pie by respecting the 'labelOffset'. The 'outside' option will place the labels at the border of the pie and 'center' will place the labels in the absolute center point of the chart. The 'center' option only makes sense in conjunction with the 'labelOffset' option. * `showLabel` {`boolean`} - If a label should be shown. * `startAngle` {`number`} - Start angle of the pie chart in degrees where 0 points north. A higher value offsets the start angle clockwise.. * `total` {`number`} - Optional total you can specify. By specifying a total value, the sum of the values in the series must be this total in order to draw a full pie. You can use this parameter to draw only parts of a pie or gauge charts. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverseData` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `axisTitles` {`{ axisX: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; axisY: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; } | undefined`} - gets axis title options * `lineBarOptions` - override this with type-specific options * `chartTitle` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chartData` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chartDesc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `plugins` {`string[][]`} - an array of plugins to load as [ [classname, relativePath] ] * `observer` - mutation observer for table * `fullOptions` - gets options plus plugins * `windowControllers` - * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsiveOptions` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. attributes.name: scale
attributes.description:
`scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)```
Container class	Ratio
.ct-square          1
.ct-minor-second	  15:16
.ct-major-second	  8:9
.ct-minor-third	    5:6
.ct-major-third	    4:5
.ct-perfect-fourth	3:4
.ct-perfect-fifth	  2:3
.ct-minor-sixth	    5:8
.ct-golden-section	1:1.618
.ct-major-sixth	    3:5
.ct-minor-seventh	  9:16
.ct-major-seventh	  8:15
.ct-octave	        1:2
.ct-major-tenth	    2:5
.ct-major-eleventh	3:8
.ct-major-twelfth	  1:3
.ct-double-octave	  1:4```

Property: scale

Default: ct-minor-seventh

Properties: * `donutData` - * `donutLabels` - * `donutTotal` {`number`} - * `animation` {`number`} - Timing for animation or -1 for false * `animationDelay` {`number`} - Timing for animation or 0 none * `complete` {`any[]`} - An array of completed values * `desc` {`string`} - Accessible long description * `imageSrc` {`string`} - Source of image in the center of the object. * `imageAlt` {`string`} - Alt text for image. * `chartPadding` {`number`} - Padding of chart drawing area to container element and labels * `donut` {`boolean`} - Displays chart as donut instead of pie. * `donutSolid` {`boolean`} - Draw donut segments as shapes instead of strokes. * `donutWidth` {`number`} - Donut stroke width, currently done in javascript. * `ignoreEmptyValues` {`boolean`} - Empty values will be ignored to avoid drawing unncessary slices and labels * `labelDirection` {`string`} - Label direction can be 'neutral', 'explode' or 'implode'. The labels anchor will be positioned based on those settings as well as the fact if the labels are on the right or left side of the center of the chart. Usually explode is useful when labels are positioned far away from the center. * `labelOffset` {`number`} - Label position offset from the standard position which is half distance of the radius. This value can be either positive or negative. Positive values will position the label away from the center. * `labelPosition` {`string`} - This option can be set to 'inside', 'outside' or 'center'. Positioned with 'inside' the labels will be placed on half the distance of the radius to the border of the Pie by respecting the 'labelOffset'. The 'outside' option will place the labels at the border of the pie and 'center' will place the labels in the absolute center point of the chart. The 'center' option only makes sense in conjunction with the 'labelOffset' option. * `showLabel` {`boolean`} - If a label should be shown. * `startAngle` {`number`} - Start angle of the pie chart in degrees where 0 points north. A higher value offsets the start angle clockwise.. * `total` {`number`} - Optional total you can specify. By specifying a total value, the sum of the values in the series must be this total in order to draw a full pie. You can use this parameter to draw only parts of a pie or gauge charts. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverseData` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `axisTitles` {`{ axisX: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; axisY: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; } | undefined`} - gets axis title options * `lineBarOptions` - override this with type-specific options * `chartTitle` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chartData` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chartDesc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `plugins` {`string[][]`} - an array of plugins to load as [ [classname, relativePath] ] * `observer` - mutation observer for table * `fullOptions` - gets options plus plugins * `windowControllers` - * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsiveOptions` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........

Default is false. * `__chartId` {`string`} - * `accentColor` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `dark` {`boolean`} - Location of the CSV file. * `colors` -

tags.name: rich-text-editor-button
tags.description:
`rich-text-editor-button`
is a basic button for rich text editor (custom buttons can extend RichTextEditorButtonBehaviors)

### Styling
`<rich-text-editor-button>` uses RichTextToolbarStyles constant to set 
SimpleToolbarBehaviors's simple-toolbar/simple-toolbar-button variables.

To further customize a toolbar and its buttons:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
--rich-text-editor-border-color | default border color | #ddd
--rich-text-editor-border-width | default border width | 1px
--rich-text-editor-bg | default toolbar background | #ffffff
--rich-text-editor-button-opacity | default button opacity | 1
--rich-text-editor-button-color | default button color | #444
--rich-text-editor-button-bg | default button background | #ffffff
--rich-text-editor-button-border-color | overrides default border-color for buttons | transparent
--rich-text-editor-button-toggled-opacity | overrides default opacity when button is toggled | 1
--rich-text-editor-button-toggled-color | overrides default text color when button is toggled | #222
--rich-text-editor-button-toggled-bg | overrides default background when button is toggled | #ddd
--rich-text-editor-button-toggled-border-color | overrides default border-color when button is toggled | transparent
--rich-text-editor-button-hover-opacity | overrides default opacity when button is hovered or focused | 1
--rich-text-editor-button-hover-color | overrides default text color when button is hovered or focused  | #000
--rich-text-editor-button-hover-bg | overrides default background when button is hovered or focused | #f0f0f0
--rich-text-editor-button-hover-border-color | overrides default border-color when button is hovered or focused | unset
--rich-text-editor-button-disabled-opacity | overrides default opacity when button is disabled | 1
--rich-text-editor-button-disabled-color | overrides default text color when button is disabled | #666
--rich-text-editor-button-disabled-bg | overrides default background when button is disabled | transparent
--rich-text-editor-button-disabled-border-color | overrides default border-color when button is toggled | transparent

Events:

  * `wrapselection` {`CustomEvent<any>`} - 

  * `command` {`CustomEvent<{ command: any; commandVal: any; range: any; button: this; }>`} - 

  * `paste` {`CustomEvent<any>`} - 

  * `rangechange` {`CustomEvent<{ element: this; range: any; }>`} - 

  * `register-button` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `deregister-button` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `button-toggled` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `update-button-registry` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `command` {`string`} - The command used for globalThis.document.execCommand.

  * `command-val` - Optional parameter for the command.

  * `toggled-command` {`string`} - The command used for globalThis.document.execCommand when toggled.

  * `toggled-command-val` - Optional parameter for the command when toggled.

  * `selectedNode` - currently selected node

  * `selectionAncestors` {`any[]`} - array of ancestors of currently selected node

  * `tagsList` {`string`} - tags edited by this button

  * `range` - current text selected range, which is actually a range.

  * `__toolbar` - 

  * `__source` - 

  * `__highlight` - 

  * `__clipboard` - 

  * `controls` {`string`} - The `id` of the `simple-toolbar` that the toolbar controls.

  * `describedby` {`string`} - Optional to set aria-describedby.

  * `target` - The active selected range, inherited from the toolbar

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Hide the null option

  * `toggled` {`boolean`} - Can this button toggle?

  * `toggles` {`boolean`} - Can this button toggle?

  * `radio` {`boolean`} - for radio-button behavior

  * `shortcut-keys` {`string`} - Optional space-separated list of shortcut keys

  * `is-current-item` {`boolean`} - 

Properties:

  * `command` {`string`} - The command used for globalThis.document.execCommand.

  * `commandVal` - Optional parameter for the command.

  * `toggledCommandVal` - Optional parameter for the command when toggled.

tags.name: rich-text-editor-source
tags.description:
`rich-text-editor-source`
a standalone rich text editor
### Styling

`<rich-text-editor-source>`  uses RichTextStyles variables, 
as well as an additional style:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
--rich-text-editor-source-min-height | minimum height of editor | 20px

Attributes:

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - don't reveal toolbar on mouseover

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - don't reveal toolbar on mouseover

  * `__target` - id for editable region

  * `__toolbar` - id for toolbar

  * `__codeEditorValue` {`string`} - code-editor for view source

  * `__needsUpdate` {`boolean`} - has focus

  * `id` {`string`} - editor's unique id

`rich-text-editor-breadcrumbs`
a toolbar of selection's ancestor breadcrumbs

### Styling
`<rich-text-editor-breadcrumbs>` uses RichTextToolbarStyles constant 
from rich-text-editor-toolbar to set SimpleToolbarBehaviors's 
simple-toolbar/simple-toolbar-button variables.

  * `sticky` {`boolean`} - Should breadcrumbs stick to top so that it is always visible?

  * `label` {`string`} - breadcrumb labels.

tags.name: rich-text-editor-toolbar
tags.description:
`rich-text-editor-toolbar`
is a default toolbar for rich text editor 
(can customize by extending RichTextEditorToolbarBehaviors)

### Styling
`<rich-text-editor-toolbar>` uses RichTextToolbarStyles constant to set 
SimpleToolbarBehaviors's simple-toolbar/simple-toolbar-button variables.

To further customize a toolbar and its buttons:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
--rich-text-editor-border-color | default border color | #ddd
--rich-text-editor-border-width | default border width | 1px
--rich-text-editor-bg | default toolbar background | #ffffff
--rich-text-editor-button-opacity | default button opacity | 1
--rich-text-editor-button-color | default button color | #444
--rich-text-editor-button-bg | default button background | #ffffff
--rich-text-editor-button-border-color | overrides default border-color for buttons | transparent
--rich-text-editor-button-toggled-opacity | overrides default opacity when button is toggled | 1
--rich-text-editor-button-toggled-color | overrides default text color when button is toggled | #222
--rich-text-editor-button-toggled-bg | overrides default background when button is toggled | #ddd
--rich-text-editor-button-toggled-border-color | overrides default border-color when button is toggled | transparent
--rich-text-editor-button-hover-opacity | overrides default opacity when button is hovered or focused | 1
--rich-text-editor-button-hover-color | overrides default text color when button is hovered or focused  | #000
--rich-text-editor-button-hover-bg | overrides default background when button is hovered or focused | #f0f0f0
--rich-text-editor-button-hover-border-color | overrides default border-color when button is hovered or focused | unset
--rich-text-editor-button-disabled-opacity | overrides default opacity when button is disabled | 1
--rich-text-editor-button-disabled-color | overrides default text color when button is disabled | #666
--rich-text-editor-button-disabled-bg | overrides default background when button is disabled | transparent
--rich-text-editor-button-disabled-border-color | overrides default border-color when button is toggled | transparent

tags.name: rich-text-editor
tags.description:
`rich-text-editor`
a standalone rich text editor
(can customize by extending RichTextEditorBehaviors)
### Styling

`<rich-text-editor>`  uses RichTextStyles variables, 
as well as an additional style:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
--rich-text-editor-min-height | minimum height of editor | 20px

Events:

  * `focus` {`CustomEvent<any>`} - 

  * `contenteditable-change` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `contenteditable` {`string`} - Maps to editing attribute

  * `disable-hover` {`boolean`} - don't reveal toolbar on mouseover

  * `rawhtml` {`string`} - raw html

  * `view-source` {`boolean`} - whether editor is view source code mode

  * `__codeEditorValue` {`string`} - code-editor for view source

  * `__needsUpdate` {`boolean`} - has focus

  * `aria-placeholder` {`string`} - Placeholder text for empty editable regions

  * `toolbar-id` {`string`} - id for toolbar

  * `type` {`string`} - type of editor toolbar, i.e.
full - full for full toolbar with breadcrumb,
mini - mini for mini floating toolbar, or
default toolbar if neither.

  * `id` {`string`} - editor's unique id

  * `range` - current range

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - don't reveal toolbar on mouseover

  * `__focused` {`boolean`} - has focus

  * `__hovered` {`boolean`} - is hovered

Properties:

  * `contenteditable` {`string`} - Maps to editing attribute

  * `disableHover` {`boolean`} - don't reveal toolbar on mouseover

  * `rawhtml` {`string`} - raw html

  * `viewSource` {`boolean`} - whether editor is view source code mode

  * `__codeEditorValue` {`string`} - code-editor for view source

  * `__needsUpdate` {`boolean`} - has focus

  * `editable` {`boolean`} - 

  * `isEmpty` {`boolean`} - 

  * `placeholder` {`string`} - Placeholder text for empty editable regions

  * `toolbarId` {`string`} - id for toolbar

  * `type` {`string`} - type of editor toolbar, i.e.
full - full for full toolbar with breadcrumb,
mini - mini for mini floating toolbar, or
default toolbar if neither.

  * `id` {`string`} - editor's unique id

  * `range` - current range

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - don't reveal toolbar on mouseover

  * `__focused` {`boolean`} - has focus

  * `__hovered` {`boolean`} - is hovered

  * `editing` {`boolean`} -

tags.name: simple-colors-shared-styles
tags.description:
Attributes:

  * `colors` - The colors object.
Each color contains an array of shades as hex codes from lightest to darkest.

  * `contrasts` - Object with information on which color combinations are WCAG 2.0AA compliant, "eg": 
{
  "greyColor": {          //if either the color or its contrast will be a grey
    "aaLarge": [          //if bold text >= 14pt, text >= 18pt, decorative only, or disabled
      {                 //for the first shade of a color
        "min": 7,         //index of the lightest contrasting shade of another color
        "max": 12         //index of the darkest contrasting shade of another color
      },
      ...
    ],
    "aa": [ ... ]         //if bold text < 14pt, or text < 18pt
  },
  "colorColor": { ... }   //if neither the color nor its contrast are grey
}

Properties:

  * `colors` - The colors object.
Each color contains an array of shades as hex codes from lightest to darkest.

  * `contrasts` - Object with information on which color combinations are WCAG 2.0AA compliant, "eg": 
{
  "greyColor": {          //if either the color or its contrast will be a grey
    "aaLarge": [          //if bold text >= 14pt, text >= 18pt, decorative only, or disabled
      {                 //for the first shade of a color
        "min": 7,         //index of the lightest contrasting shade of another color
        "max": 12         //index of the darkest contrasting shade of another color
      },
      ...
    ],
    "aa": [ ... ]         //if bold text < 14pt, or text < 18pt
  },
  "colorColor": { ... }   //if neither the color nor its contrast are grey
}

tags.name: simple-colors-swatches
tags.description:
`simple-colors-swatches`
`A tool to document of all the colors in simple-colors`

### Styling

`<simple-colors-swatches>` provides the following custom properties and mixins
for styling. See demo of "all of the colors" (`demo/colors.html`) for color variable styling.

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--simple-colors-swatch-contrast` | Modal title bar text color. | unset
`--simple-colors-swatch-color` | Modal title bar background color. | unset

Attributes:

  * `swatch-id` {`string`} - The id of the swatch (`color_index`)

  * `swatch-name` {`string`} - The swatch name (`color-shade`)

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - a selected accent-"color": grey, red, pink, purple, etc.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - make the default theme dark?

tags.name: simple-colors-picker
tags.description:
`simple-colors-picker`
a select element for changing `simple-colors` attributes in demos

### Styling
See demo of "all of the colors" (`demo/colors.html`) for styling.

Events:

  * `change` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when options or value changes

  * `changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - Fires when properties change

  * `click` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - handles listbox click event

  * `mousedown` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires with listbox mousedown event

  * `keydown` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `option-focus` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when active descendant changes

  * `value-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when value changes

  * `expand` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when listbox is expanded

  * `collapse` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when listbox is collapsed

Attributes:

  * `shades` {`boolean`} - Show all shades instead of just main accent-colors

  * `hide-null-option` {`boolean`} - hide the null option
Default behavior/false will select first option and set value accordingly.

  * `justify` {`boolean`} - Box is 100% width of the ui

  * `__options` {`any[]`} - An array of options for picker, eg.: `
[
[
{
  "icon": "editor:format-paint",      //Optional. Used if picker is used as an icon picker.
  "alt": "Blue",                      //Required for accessibility. Alt text description of choice.
  "style": "background-color: blue;", //Optional. Used to set an option's style.
  ...                                 //Optional. Any other properties that should be captured as part of selected option's value
},...
]
]`

  * `allow-null` {`boolean`} - allow a null value?
Default behavior/false will select first option and set value accordingly.

  * `align-right` {`boolean`} - Align right edges of listbox and button?
Default behavior/false aligns to left edges.

  * `aria-labelledby` {`string`} - Optional. Sets aria-labelledby attribute

  * `block-label` {`boolean`} - Position label above select dropdown?

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Is picker disabled?

  * `expanded` {`boolean`} - Is it expanded?

  * `hide-option-labels` {`boolean`} - Hide option labels? As color-picker or icon-picker, labels may be redundant.
This option would move labels off-screen so that only screen-readers will have them.

  * `hide-sample` {`boolean`} - Hide selected item sample?
Default behavior/false shows a sample without expanding menu.

  * `label` {`string`} - Optional. Label for picker input

  * `__ready` {`boolean`} - 

  * `options` {`{}[][]`} - An array of options for picker, eg.: 
[
[
{
  "icon": "editor:format-paint",      //Optional. Used if picker is used as an icon picker.
  "alt": "Blue",                      //Required for accessibility. Alt text description of choice.
  "style": "background-color: blue;", //Optional. Used to set an option's style.
  ...                                 //Optional. Any other properties that should be captured as part of selected option's value
},...
]
]

  * `title-as-html` {`boolean`} - Renders html as title. (Good for titles with HTML in them.)

  * `value` {`string`} - An string that stores current value for picker

  * `__activeDesc` {`string`} - Aria-activedescendant attribute (active option's ID)

  * `__selectedOption` - Selected option based on value of picker

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - a selected accent-"color": grey, red, pink, purple, etc.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - make the default theme dark?

Properties:

  * `shades` {`boolean`} - Show all shades instead of just main accent-colors

tags.name: simple-fields-array-item
tags.description:
`simple-fields-array-item`
an accessible expand collapse

### Styling

`<simple-fields-array-item>` provides the following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--simple-fields-array-item-margin` | margin around simple-fields-array-item | 15px 0
`--simple-fields-array-item-border` | border around simple-fields-array-item | 1px solid
`--simple-fields-array-item-horizontal-padding` | horizontal padding inside simple-fields-array-item | 16px
`--simple-fields-array-item-horizontal-padding-left` | left padding inside simple-fields-array-item | `--simple-fields-array-item-horizontal-padding`
`--simple-fields-array-item-horizontal-padding-right` | right padding inside simple-fields-array-item | `--simple-fields-array-item-horizontal-padding`
`--simple-fields-array-item-vertical-padding` | vertical padding inside simple-fields-array-item | 16px
`--simple-fields-array-item-horizontal-padding-top` | top padding inside simple-fields-array-item | `--simple-fields-array-item-vertical-padding`
`--simple-fields-array-item-horizontal-padding-bottom` | bottom padding inside simple-fields-array-item | --simple-fields-array-item-vertical-padding
`--simple-fields-array-item-border-between` | border between simple-fields-array-item heading and content | --simple-fields-array-item-border
`--simple-fields-array-item-heading-font-weight` | font-weight for simple-fields-array-item heading | bold
`--simple-fields-array-item-heading-color` | text color for simple-fields-array-item heading | unset
`--simple-fields-array-item-heading-background-color` | background-color for simple-fields-array-item heading | unset
