tags.name: simple-fields-code
tags.description:
`simple-fields-code`
 HTML inputs (excluding submit, reset, button, and image)
 with label, description, error massage,
 and aria-invalid functionality if needed.

Events:

  * `value-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `error-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `editor-value` {`string`} - changes the value of the editor

  * `focused` {`boolean`} - Whether the field is hidden

  * `theme` {`string`} - theme of code-editor

  * `autofocus` {`boolean`} - Automatically focus on field when the page is loaded

  * `font-size` {`number`} - Font-size of editor

  * `language` {`string`} - language of code-editor

  * `mode` {`number`} - mode of code-editor

  * `description` {`string`} - Optional description of the field (or use slot="description")

  * `defaultErrorMessage` {`string`} - Optional validation error message to display

  * `defaultRequiredMessage` {`string`} - Optional required validation error message to display

  * `errorMessage` {`string`} - Validation error message to display

  * `field` - Field element

  * `label` {`string`} - Label for the field (or use slot="label")

  * `minchecked` {`number`} - Minimum number of checked items in fieldset

  * `maxchecked` {`number`} - Minimum number of checked items in fieldset

  * `maxwords` {`number`} - Maximum number of words in textarea

  * `name` {`string`} - Name of the input form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `numberMessage` {`string`} - error message when number of items selected is not between min and max

  * `pattern` {`string`} - regex pattern the value must match to be valid

  * `patternMessage` {`string`} - error message when field does not match pattern

  * `prefix` {`string`} - Optional prefix string (or use slot="prefix")

  * `readonly` {`boolean`} - Value is not editable

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Whether field is required

  * `requiredMessage` {`string`} - error message when field is required and has no value

  * `suffix` {`string`} - Optional suffix string (or use slot="suffix")

  * `type` {`string`} - Type of input form control

  * `value` - Current value of the form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `is-simple-field-type` {`boolean`} - a simple boolean so that we can easily select ALL
things derived from simple fields regardless of
their eventual tag name

  * `counter` {`string`} - a counter text and textareas: "character", "word" or unset for none

  * `autovalidate` {`boolean`} - Automatically validate field

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Whether the form control is disabled

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - Whether the field is hidden

  * `error` {`boolean`} - Whether field has errors

  * `id` {`string`} - Unique id

  * `inline` {`boolean`} - Whether field and label should be inline

  * `validTypes` {`any[]`} - List of valid field types

tags.name: simple-fields-container
tags.description:
`simple-fields-container`
 Progressive enhanced container HTML fields
 with label, description, error massage,
 and aria-invalid functionality if needed.

Events:

  * `error-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `description` {`string`} - Optional description of the field (or use slot="description")

  * `defaultErrorMessage` {`string`} - Optional validation error message to display

  * `defaultRequiredMessage` {`string`} - Optional required validation error message to display

  * `errorMessage` {`string`} - Validation error message to display

  * `field` - Field element

  * `label` {`string`} - Label for the field (or use slot="label")

  * `minchecked` {`number`} - Minimum number of checked items in fieldset

  * `maxchecked` {`number`} - Minimum number of checked items in fieldset

  * `maxwords` {`number`} - Maximum number of words in textarea

  * `name` {`string`} - Name of the input form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `numberMessage` {`string`} - error message when number of items selected is not between min and max

  * `pattern` {`string`} - regex pattern the value must match to be valid

  * `patternMessage` {`string`} - error message when field does not match pattern

  * `prefix` {`string`} - Optional prefix string (or use slot="prefix")

  * `readonly` {`boolean`} - Value is not editable

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Whether field is required

  * `requiredMessage` {`string`} - error message when field is required and has no value

  * `suffix` {`string`} - Optional suffix string (or use slot="suffix")

  * `type` {`string`} - Type of input form control

  * `value` - Value of field

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `is-simple-field-type` {`boolean`} - a simple boolean so that we can easily select ALL
things derived from simple fields regardless of

  * `id` {`string`} - Unique id

tags.name: simple-fields-field
tags.description:
`simple-fields-field`
 HTML inputs (excluding submit, reset, button, and image)
 with label, description, error massage,
 and aria-invalid functionality if needed.

Events:

  * `value-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `error-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `accept` {`string`} - Hint for expected file type in file upload controls

  * `block-options` {`boolean`} - if element is a a list of radio or checkbox options,
will to display each item as a block instead of inline

  * `capture` {`string`} - Media capture input method in file upload controls

  * `dirname` {`string`} - Name of form field to use for sending the element's directionality in form submission

  * `list` {`string`} - Value of the id attribute of the `<datalist>` of autocomplete options

  * `max` {`number`} - Maximum value for numeric field types

  * `maxlength` {`number`} - Maximum length (number of characters) of `value`

  * `min` {`number`} - Minimum value for numeric field types

  * `minlength` {`number`} - Minimum length (number of characters) of `value`

  * `placeholder` {`string`} - Content to be appear in the form control when the form control is empty

  * `size` {`number`} - Size of the control

  * `step` {`number`} - Incremental values that are valid

  * `autocomplete` {`string`} - Hint for form autofill feature

  * `autofocus` {`boolean`} - Automatically focus on field when the page is loaded

  * `multiple` {`boolean`} - Whether to allow multiple values

  * `spellcheck` {`string`} - Whether input subject to spell checking by browser/OS as "true", "default", or "false"

  * `items-list` {`any[]`} - array of options [{value: "key", text: "Text"}] for select, radio options, and checkboxes,
so that they can appear in a prescribed order,
eg. [{value: "b", text: "Option B"}, {value: "a", text: "Option A"}, {value: "c", text: "Option C"}]

  * `options` - options {value: "Text"}  for select, radio options, and checkboxes,
which are sorted by key,
eg. {a: "Option A", b: "Option B", c: "Option C"}

  * `hovered` {`boolean`} - hover state pegged to attribute

  * `wrap` {`boolean`} - text wrapping for textarea,
"hard": automatically inserts line breaks (CR+LF)
"soft": all line breaks as CR+LF pair
"off" : no wrapping / <textarea> becomes horizontally scrollable

  * `description` {`string`} - Optional description of the field (or use slot="description")

  * `defaultErrorMessage` {`string`} - Optional validation error message to display

  * `defaultRequiredMessage` {`string`} - Optional required validation error message to display

  * `errorMessage` {`string`} - Validation error message to display

  * `field` - Field element

  * `label` {`string`} - Label for the field (or use slot="label")

  * `minchecked` {`number`} - Minimum number of checked items in fieldset

  * `maxchecked` {`number`} - Minimum number of checked items in fieldset

  * `maxwords` {`number`} - Maximum number of words in textarea

  * `name` {`string`} - Name of the input form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `numberMessage` {`string`} - error message when number of items selected is not between min and max

  * `pattern` {`string`} - regex pattern the value must match to be valid

  * `patternMessage` {`string`} - error message when field does not match pattern

  * `prefix` {`string`} - Optional prefix string (or use slot="prefix")

  * `readonly` {`boolean`} - Value is not editable

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Whether field is required

  * `requiredMessage` {`string`} - error message when field is required and has no value

  * `suffix` {`string`} - Optional suffix string (or use slot="suffix")

  * `type` {`string`} - Type of input form control

  * `value` - Current value of the form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `is-simple-field-type` {`boolean`} - a simple boolean so that we can easily select ALL
things derived from simple fields regardless of
their eventual tag name

  * `counter` {`string`} - a counter text and textareas: "character", "word" or unset for none

  * `autovalidate` {`boolean`} - Automatically validate field

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Whether the form control is disabled

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - Whether the field is hidden

  * `error` {`boolean`} - Whether field has errors

  * `id` {`string`} - Unique id

  * `inline` {`boolean`} - Whether field and label should be inline

  * `validTypes` {`any[]`} - List of valid field types

Properties:

  * `accept` {`string`} - Hint for expected file type in file upload controls

  * `blockOptions` {`boolean`} - if element is a a list of radio or checkbox options,
will to display each item as a block instead of inline

  * `capture` {`string`} - Media capture input method in file upload controls

  * `dirname` {`string`} - Name of form field to use for sending the element's directionality in form submission

  * `list` {`string`} - Value of the id attribute of the `<datalist>` of autocomplete options

  * `max` {`number`} - Maximum value for numeric field types

  * `min` {`number`} - Minimum value for numeric field types

  * `placeholder` {`string`} - Content to be appear in the form control when the form control is empty

  * `description` {`string`} - Optional description of the field (or use slot="description")

  * `defaultErrorMessage` {`string`} - Optional validation error message to display

  * `defaultRequiredMessage` {`string`} - Optional required validation error message to display

  * `errorMessage` {`string`} - Validation error message to display

  * `field` - Field element

  * `label` {`string`} - Label for the field (or use slot="label")

  * `minchecked` {`number`} - Minimum number of checked items in fieldset

  * `maxchecked` {`number`} - Minimum number of checked items in fieldset

  * `maxwords` {`number`} - Maximum number of words in textarea

  * `name` {`string`} - Name of the input form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `numberMessage` {`string`} - error message when number of items selected is not between min and max

  * `pattern` {`string`} - regex pattern the value must match to be valid

  * `patternMessage` {`string`} - error message when field does not match pattern

  * `prefix` {`string`} - Optional prefix string (or use slot="prefix")

  * `readonly` {`boolean`} - Value is not editable

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Whether field is required

  * `requiredMessage` {`string`} - error message when field is required and has no value

  * `suffix` {`string`} - Optional suffix string (or use slot="suffix")

  * `type` {`string`} - Type of input form control

  * `value` - Current value of the form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `descriptionTemplate` - template for slotted or shadow DOM description

  * `errorTemplate` - template for slotted or shadow DOM error message

  * `fieldBottom` - gets bottom (metadata, description, and error message) of a field

  * `fieldId` {`string`} - gets field's id

  * `fieldMainTemplate` - template label and field

  * `fieldMeta` - gets field metadata

  * `hasFieldset` {`boolean`} -

tags.name: simple-fields-lite
tags.description:
`simple-fields-lite`
Uses JSON Schema of fields to display a series of fields

### Styling
`<simple-fields-lite>` provides following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-margin` | vertical margin around container | 16px
`--simple-fields-margin-small` | smaller vertical margin above field itself | 8px
`--simple-fields-border-radius` | default border-radius | 2px
`--simple-fields-color` | text color | black
`--simple-fields-background-color` | background color | transparent
`--simple-fields-error-color` | error text color | #b40000
`--simple-fields-accent-color` | accent text/underline color | #3f51b5
`--simple-fields-border-color` | border-/underline color | #999

#### Field text
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-font-size` | font-size of field | 16px
`--simple-fields-font-family` | font-size of field | sans-serif
`--simple-fields-line-height` | line-height of field | 22px

#### Detail text
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-detail-font-size` | font-size of field details | 12px
`--simple-fields-detail-font-family` | font-size of field details | sans-serif
`--simple-fields-detail-line-height` | line-height of field details | 22px

#### Disabled Fields
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-disabled-color` | disabled text color | #999
`--simple-fields-disabled-opacity` | opacity for disabled field | 0.7

### JSON Schema Format
This element accepts JSON schema with additional features noted in the example below:
```
{
$schema: "http://json-schema.org/schema#",
title: "Store",
type: "object",
format: "tabs",                                 //default object behavior can be overridden by format
required: [ "name", "email" ],
  properties: {
    settings: {
      title: "Settings",
      description: "Configure the following.",
      type: "object",
      format: "tabs",
      properties: {
        "basic-input": {
          title: "Basic input page",
          description: "Basic contact settings",
          type: "object",
          properties: {
            branch: {
              title: "Branch",
              type: "string"
            },
              name: {
                title: "Name",
                type: "string"
              },
              address: {
                title: "Address",
                type: "string",
                minLength: 3
              },
              city: {
                title: "City",
                type: "string",
                minLength: 3
              },
              province: {
                title: "Province",
                type: "string",
                minLength: 2
              },
              country: {
                title: "Country",
                type: "string",
                minLength: 2
              },
              postalCode: {
                title: "Postal/Zip Code",
                type: "string",
                pattern:
                  "[a-zA-Z][0-9][a-zA-Z]\\s*[0-9][a-zA-Z][0-9]|[0-9]{5}(-[0-9]{4})?"
              },
              email: {
                title: "Email",
                type: "string",
                pattern:
                  "(?:^[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\\.[A-Za-z]{2,4}$)|(?:^$)"
              },
              website: {
                title: "Website",
                type: "string",
                format: "uri"
              },
              establishedDate: {
                title: "Established Date",
                type: "string",
                format: "date"
              },
              closedDate: {
                title: "Closed Date",
                type: ["string", "null"],
                format: "date"
              }
            }
          },
          arrays: {
          title: "Basic arrays page",
          description: "Demonstrates arrays",
          type: "object",
          properties: {
            phoneNumbers: {
              title: "Phone numbers",
              description: "List phone numbers and type of number.",
              type: "array",
              items: {
                type: "object",
                previewBy: ["phoneNumber"],                               //simple-fields-array allows a preview field 
                                                                          //for progressive disclosure of array items
                properties: {
                  type: {
                    title: "Type",
                    type: "string"
                  },
                  phoneNumber: {
                    title: "Phone Number",
                    type: "string"
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### Configuring schemaConversion Property
You can customise elements from JSON schema conversion by setting `schemaConversion` property.
```
type: {                                       //For properties in "this.schema", define elements based on a property's "type"
object: {                                   //Defines element used when property's "type" is an "object"
  format: {                                 //Optional: define elements for "object" properties by "format"
    "tabs": {                               //Defines element used for object properties when "format" is "tabs"
      element: "a11y-tabs"                  //Element to create, eg. "paper-input", "select", "simple-fields-array", etc.
      descriptionProperty: "description"    //Optional: element's property that sets its description, e.g. "description"
      descriptionSlot: "description"        //Optional: element's slot that contains its description, e.g. "description"
      errorProperty: "error"                //Optional: element's property that sets its error status, e.g. "error"
      errorChangedProperty: "error"         //Optional: event element fires when error status changes, e.g. "error-changed"
      errorMessageProperty: "errorMessage"  //Optional: element's property that sets its error message, e.g. "errorMessage"
      errorMessageSlot: "errorMessage"      //Optional: element's slot that contains its error message, e.g. "errorMessage"
      labelProperty: "label"                //Optional: element's property that sets its label, e.g. "label"
      labelSlot: "label"                    //Optional: element's slot that contains its label, e.g. "label"
      prefixSlot: "prefix"                  //Optional: element's slot that contains its prefix, e.g. "prefix"
      suffixSlot: "suffix"                  //Optional: element's slot that contains its suffix, e.g. "suffix"
      valueProperty: "value"                //Optional: element's property that gets its value, e.g. "value" or "checked"
      setValueProperty: "value"             //Optional: element's property that sets its value, e.g. "value" or "checked" (default is same as valueProperty)
      valueChangedProperty: "value-changed" //Optional: event element fires when value property changes, e.g. "value-changed" or "click"
      valueSlot: ""                         //Optional: element's slot that's used to set its value, e.g. ""
      description: ""                       //Optional: element that contains description, e.g. "p", "span", "paper-tooltip", etc.
      child: {                              //Optional: child elements to be appended
        element: "a11y-tab"                 //Optional: type of child element, eg. "paper-input", "select", "simple-fields-array", etc.
        attributes: {                       //Optional: sets child element's attributes based on this.schemaConversion
          disabled: true                    //Example: sets disabled to true  
        } 
        properties: {                       //Optional: sets child element's attributes based on this.schema properties
          icon: "iconName"                  //Example: sets child element's icon property to this.schema property's iconName 
        }, 
        slots: {                            //Optional: inserts schema properties in child element's slots
          label: "label",                   //Example: places schema property's label into child element's label slot
          "": "description"                 //Example: places schema property's description into child element's unnamed slot
        } 
      },
      attributes: {},
      properties: {},
      slots: {}
    }
  },
  defaultSettings: {                        //Default element used for object properties
    element: ""
    label: ""
    description: ""     
    attributes: {}       
    properties: {}       
    slots: {}           
  }
}
}
```

Events:

  * `fields-ready` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `value-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `fields-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `schema-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `error` - Error messages by field name,
eg. `{ contactinfo.email: "A valid email is required." }`

  * `elementizer` - Conversion from JSON Schema to HTML form elements.
_See [Configuring schemaConversion Property](configuring-the-schemaConversion-property) above._

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `disableAutofocus` {`boolean`} - Disables autofocus on fields.

  * `lang` {`string`} - Language of the fields.

  * `resources` - resource link

  * `__formElements` - form elements by id and config data in schema

  * `__formElementsArray` {`any[]`} - list form elements in order and config data in schema

  * `schema` - Fields schema.
_See [Fields Schema Format](fields-schema-format) above._

  * `value` - value of fields

Properties:

  * `error` - Error messages by field name,
eg. `{ contactinfo.email: "A valid email is required." }`

  * `elementizer` - Conversion from JSON Schema to HTML form elements.
_See [Configuring schemaConversion Property](configuring-the-schemaConversion-property) above._

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `formElements` - form elements by id

  * `formElementsArray` {`any[]`} - list of form elements in order

  * `schemaConversion` - gets JSON schema to form element conversion object

  * `valid` {`boolean`} - whether there are no errors

  * `disableAutofocus` {`boolean`} - Disables autofocus on fields.

  * `language` {`string`} - Language of the fields.

  * `resources` - resource link

  * `__formElements` - form elements by id and config data in schema

  * `__formElementsArray` {`any[]`} - list form elements in order and config data in schema

  * `schema` - Fields schema.
_See [Fields Schema Format](fields-schema-format) above._

  * `value` - value of fields

  * `accept` {`string`} - Hint for expected file type in file upload controls

  * `block-options` {`boolean`} - if element is a a list of radio or checkbox options,
will to display each item as a block instead of inline

  * `capture` {`string`} - Media capture input method in file upload controls

  * `dirname` {`string`} - Name of form field to use for sending the element's directionality in form submission

  * `list` {`string`} - Value of the id attribute of the `<datalist>` of autocomplete options

  * `max` {`number`} - Maximum value for numeric field types

  * `maxlength` {`number`} - Maximum length (number of characters) of `value`

  * `min` {`number`} - Minimum value for numeric field types

  * `minlength` {`number`} - Minimum length (number of characters) of `value`

  * `placeholder` {`string`} - Content to be appear in the form control when the form control is empty

  * `size` {`number`} - Size of the control

  * `step` {`number`} - Incremental values that are valid

  * `autocomplete` {`string`} - Hint for form autofill feature

  * `autofocus` {`boolean`} - Automatically focus on field when the page is loaded

  * `multiple` {`boolean`} - Whether to allow multiple values

  * `spellcheck` {`string`} - Whether input subject to spell checking by browser/OS as "true", "default", or "false"

  * `items-list` {`any[]`} - array of options [{value: "key", text: "Text"}] for select, radio options, and checkboxes,
so that they can appear in a prescribed order,
eg. [{value: "b", text: "Option B"}, {value: "a", text: "Option A"}, {value: "c", text: "Option C"}]

  * `options` - options {value: "Text"}  for select, radio options, and checkboxes,
which are sorted by key,
eg. {a: "Option A", b: "Option B", c: "Option C"}

  * `hovered` {`boolean`} - hover state pegged to attribute

  * `wrap` {`boolean`} - text wrapping for textarea,
"hard": automatically inserts line breaks (CR+LF)
"soft": all line breaks as CR+LF pair
"off" : no wrapping / <textarea> becomes horizontally scrollable

  * `description` {`string`} - Optional description of the field (or use slot="description")

  * `defaultErrorMessage` {`string`} - Optional validation error message to display

  * `defaultRequiredMessage` {`string`} - Optional required validation error message to display

  * `errorMessage` {`string`} - Validation error message to display

  * `maxwords` {`number`} - Maximum number of words in textarea

  * `name` {`string`} - Name of the input form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `numberMessage` {`string`} - error message when number of items selected is not between min and max

  * `pattern` {`string`} - regex pattern the value must match to be valid

  * `patternMessage` {`string`} - error message when field does not match pattern

  * `prefix` {`string`} - Optional prefix string (or use slot="prefix")

  * `readonly` {`boolean`} - Value is not editable

  * `requiredMessage` {`string`} - error message when field is required and has no value

  * `suffix` {`string`} - Optional suffix string (or use slot="suffix")

  * `type` {`string`} - Type of input form control

  * `value` - Current value of the form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

things derived from simple fields regardless of

  * `error` {`boolean`} - Whether field has errors

  * `id` - Unique id

  * `inline` {`boolean`} - Whether field and label should be inline

  * `validTypes` {`any[]`} - List of valid field types

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - a selected accent-"color": grey, red, pink, purple, etc.

"hard": automatically inserts line breaks (CR+LF)
"soft": all line breaks as CR+LF pair
"off" : no wrapping / <textarea> becomes horizontally scrollable

  * `prefix` {`string`} - Optional prefix string (or use slot="prefix")

  * `readonly` {`boolean`} - Value is not editable

  * `required` {`boolean`} - Whether field is required

  * `requiredMessage` {`string`} - error message when field is required and has no value

  * `suffix` {`string`} - Optional suffix string (or use slot="suffix")

  * `type` {`string`} - Type of input form control

  * `value` - Current value of the form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `multicheck` {`boolean`} - 

  * `numberError` {`number | false`} - determines if number of items selected
is not between min and max

  * `numeric` {`boolean`} - determines if field is numeric

  * `patternError` - determines if value does not match regex pattern

  * `prefixTemplate` - template for slotted or shadow DOM prefix

  * `requiredError` - determines if field is required and blank

  * `slottedFieldObserver` {`void`} - overridden mutation observer

  * `suffixTemplate` - template for slotted or shadow DOM suffix

  * `isSimpleFieldType` {`boolean`} - a simple boolean so that we can easily select ALL
things derived from simple fields regardless of
their eventual tag name

tags.name: simple-fields-url-combo-item
tags.description:
`simple-fields-url-combo-item`
`displays a selectable list of resources as a grid or combobox`

Attributes:

  * `name` {`string`} - human readable name, label, text, or title of resource

  * `icon` {`string`} - optional: preferred icon for resource

  * `preview` {`string`} - optional: preferred url for thumbnail image preview of resource

  * `type` {`string`} - optional: preferred resource file type

  * `value` {`string`} - url, src, id, filename or other unique value for resource

Properties:

  * `iconTypes` {`{ anchor: string; page: string; pdf: string; doc: string; docx: string; ppt: string; pptx: string; csv: string; xls: string; xlsx: string; url: string; file: string; mp4: string; mov: string; webm: string; mp3: string; wav: string; html: string; tel: string; email: string; }`} - default list of icons by file extension

  * `currentLocation` - default site location

  * `resourceURL` - URL object from value string

  * `isLocal` {`boolean`} - whether or not value is local to current site

  * `isSamePage` {`boolean`} - whether or not value on same as current location

  * `isAnchor` {`boolean`} - whether or not value is an anchor on current page

  * `fileExtension` {`string`} - value's file extension

  * `imageTypes` {`string`} - file extensions of images that can be previewed on the web

  * `pageTypes` {`string`} - file extensions of web pages

  * `isPage` {`boolean`} - whether value is a web page

  * `isEmail` {`boolean`} - whether value is an email address

  * `isPhone` {`boolean`} - whether value is a phone number

  * `isImage` {`boolean`} - whether value is an image

  * `previewSrc` {`string`} - gets url for preview thumbnail

  * `iconName` {`string`} - icon name for item based

  * `iconTemplate` - icon template of item

  * `imageTemplate` - preview image template of item

  * `previewTemplate` - preview template, based on preview or icon by default;
if none is provided, template based on previewSrc or iconName

  * `labelTemplate` - label template for item

  * `primaryLabelTemplate` - primary label template with item name or value

  * `secondaryLabelTemplate` - secondary label template with item value

  * `name` {`string`} - human readable name, label, text, or title of resource

  * `icon` {`string`} - optional: preferred icon for resource

  * `preview` {`string`} - optional: preferred url for thumbnail image preview of resource

  * `type` {`string`} - optional: preferred resource file type

  * `value` {`string`} - url, src, id, filename or other unique value for resource

will to display each item as a block instead of inline

  * `sortedOptions` - gets a sorted list of option

  * `autofocus` {`boolean`} - Automatically focus on field when the page is loaded

  * `multiple` {`boolean`} - Whether to allow multiple values

  * `spellcheck` {`string`} - Whether input subject to spell checking by browser/OS as "true", "default", or "false"

  * `itemsList` {`any[]`} - array of options [{value: "key", text: "Text"}] for select, radio options, and checkboxes,
so that they can appear in a prescribed order,
eg. [{value: "b", text: "Option B"}, {value: "a", text: "Option A"}, {value: "c", text: "Option C"}]

  * `options` - options {value: "Text"}  for select, radio options, and checkboxes,
which are sorted by key,
eg. {a: "Option A", b: "Option B", c: "Option C"}

  * `hovered` {`boolean`} - hover state pegged to attribute

  * `wrap` {`boolean`} - text wrapping for textarea,
"hard": automatically inserts line breaks (CR+LF)
"soft": all line breaks as CR+LF pair
"off" : no wrapping / <textarea> becomes horizontally scrollable

  * `pattern` {`string`} - regex pattern the value must match to be valid

  * `prefix` {`string`} - Optional prefix string (or use slot="prefix")

  * `readonly` {`boolean`} - Value is not editable

  * `suffix` {`string`} - Optional suffix string (or use slot="suffix")

  * `type` {`string`} - Type of input form control

  * `value` - Current value of the form control. Submitted with the form as part of a name/value pair.

  * `fieldId` {`string`} - gets field's id

is not between min and max

  * `numeric` {`boolean`} - determines if field is numeric

  * `patternError` - determines if value does not match regex pattern

  * `prefixTemplate` - template for slotted or shadow DOM prefix

  * `requiredError` - determines if field is required and blank

things derived from simple fields regardless of

tags.name: simple-fields
tags.description:
`simple-fields`
Uses JSON Schema to display a series of fields

### Styling
`<simple-fields>` provides following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-margin` | vertical margin around container | 16px
`--simple-fields-margin-small` | smaller vertical margin above field itself | 8px
`--simple-fields-border-radus` | default border-radius | 2px
`--simple-fields-color` | text color | black
`--simple-fields-error-color` | error text color | #b40000
`--simple-fields-accent-color` | accent text/underline color | #3f51b5
`--simple-fields-border-color` | border-/underline color | #999
`--simple-fields-border-color-light` | used for range tracks | #ccc
`--simple-fields-faded-error-color` | used for range tracks | #ffc0c0

#### Field text
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-font-size` | font-size of field | 16px
`--simple-fields-font-family` | font-size of field | sans-serif
`--simple-fields-line-height` | line-height of field | 22px

#### Detail text
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-detail-font-size` | font-size of field details | 12px
`--simple-fields-detail-font-family` | font-size of field details | sans-serif
`--simple-fields-detail-line-height` | line-height of field details | 22px

#### Disabled Fields
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-disabled-color` | disabled text color | #999
`--simple-fields-disabled-opacity` | opacity for disabled field | 0.7

#### Radio Buttons and Checkboxes
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-radio-option-display` | display label with field (flex) or above (block) | flex
`--simple-fields-radio-option-flex-wrap` | allow radio options to wrap to next line | wrap

### Configuring schemaConversion Property
You can customise elements from JSON schema conversion by setting `schemaConversion` property.
```
type: {                                       //For properties in "this.schema", define elements based on a property's "type"
object: {                                   //Defines element used when property's "type" is an "object"
  format: {                                 //Optional: define elements for "object" properties by "format"
    "tabs": {                               //Defines element used for object properties when "format" is "tabs"
      element: "a11y-tabs"                  //Element to create, eg. "paper-input", "select", "simple-fields-array", etc.
      descriptionProperty: "description"    //Optional: element's property that sets its description, e.g. "description"
      descriptionSlot: "description"        //Optional: element's slot that contains its description, e.g. "description"
      errorProperty: "error"                //Optional: element's property that sets its error status, e.g. "error"
      errorChangedProperty: "error"         //Optional: event element fires when error status changes, e.g. "error-changed"
      errorMessageProperty: "errorMessage"  //Optional: element's property that sets its error message, e.g. "errorMessage"
      errorMessageSlot: "errorMessage"      //Optional: element's slot that contains its error message, e.g. "errorMessage"
      labelProperty: "label"                //Optional: element's property that sets its label, e.g. "label"
      labelSlot: "label"                    //Optional: element's slot that contains its label, e.g. "label"
      valueProperty: "value"                //Optional: element's property that gets its value, e.g. "value" or "checked"
      setValueProperty: "value"             //Optional: element's property that sets its value, e.g. "value" or "checked" (default is same as valueProperty)
      valueChangedProperty: "value-changed" //Optional: event element fires when value property changes, e.g. "value-changed" or "click"
      valueSlot: ""                         //Optional: element's slot that's used to set its value, e.g. ""
      description: ""                       //Optional: element that contains description, e.g. "p", "span", "paper-tooltip", etc.
      child: {                              //Optional: child elements to be appended
        element: "a11y-tab"                 //Optional: type of child element, eg. "paper-input", "select", "simple-fields-array", etc.
        attributes: {                       //Optional: sets child element's attributes based on this.schemaConversion
          disabled: true                    //Example: sets disabled to true  
        } 
        properties: {                       //Optional: sets child element's attributes based on this.schema properties
          icon: "iconName"                  //Example: sets child element's icon property to this.schema property's iconName 
        }, 
        slots: {                            //Optional: inserts schema properties in child element's slots
          label: "label",                   //Example: places schema property's label into child element's label slot
          "": "description"                 //Example: places schema property's description into child element's unnamed slot
        } 
      },
      attributes: {},
      properties: {},
      slots: {}
    }
  },
  defaultSettings: {                        //Default element used for object properties
    element: ""
    label: ""
    description: ""     
    attributes: {}       
    properties: {}       
    slots: {}           
  }
}
}
``` 
### Configuring fieldsConversion Property
You can customise fields to JSON schema conversion by setting `fieldsConversion` property.
```
defaultSettings: {            //default JSON schema type if no type is matched
type: "string"              //sets JSON schema type to string
},
inputMethod: {                //for fields in "this.fields", define elements based on a property's "inputMethod"
colorpicker: {              //settings if inputMethod is color picker
  defaultSettings: {        //default colorpicker settings
    type: "string",         //sets JSON schema type to string
    format: "color"         //sets JSON schema format to color
  }
}
}
```

Events:

  * `active-tabs-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `fields-ready` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `value-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `fields-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `schema-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `fields` {`any[]`} - Fields to convert to JSON Schema.

  * `schematizer` - Conversion from fields array with inputMethods to JSON schema types and formats.
_See [Configuring fieldsConversion Property](configuring-the-fieldsconversion-property) above._

  * `label` {`string`} - Schema label

  * `active-path` - tracks all activeTabs as an object

  * `code-theme` {`string`} - default theme for code editor

  * `disable-responsive` {`boolean`} - 

  * `error` - Error messages by field name,
eg. `{ contactinfo.email: "A valid email is required." }`

  * `elementizer` - Conversion from JSON Schema to HTML form elements.
_See [Configuring schemaConversion Property](configuring-the-schemaConversion-property) above._

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `disableAutofocus` {`boolean`} - Disables autofocus on fields.

  * `lang` {`string`} - Language of the fields.

  * `resources` - resource link

  * `__formElements` - form elements by id and config data in schema

  * `__formElementsArray` {`any[]`} - list form elements in order and config data in schema

  * `schema` - Fields schema.
_See [Fields Schema Format](fields-schema-format) above._

  * `value` - value of fields

Properties:

  * `fields` {`any[]`} - Fields to convert to JSON Schema.

  * `schematizer` - Conversion from fields array with inputMethods to JSON schema types and formats.
_See [Configuring fieldsConversion Property](configuring-the-fieldsconversion-property) above._

  * `label` {`string`} - Schema label

  * `__activeTabs` - tracks all activeTabs as an object

  * `codeTheme` {`string`} - default theme for code editor

  * `convertedSchema` {`{ $schema: string; title: any; type: string; required: never[]; properties: {}; }`} - fields converted to JSON schema =

  * `fieldsConversion` - gets fields array to JSON schema conversion object

  * `activeTabs` - 

  * `__codeElements` {`never[]`} - 

  * `disableResponsive` {`boolean`} - 

  * `error` - Error messages by field name,
eg. `{ contactinfo.email: "A valid email is required." }`

  * `elementizer` - Conversion from JSON Schema to HTML form elements.
_See [Configuring schemaConversion Property](configuring-the-schemaConversion-property) above._

  * `__delayedFocus` {`boolean`} - delays focus even until field is attached

  * `formElements` - form elements by id

  * `formElementsArray` {`any[]`} - list of form elements in order

  * `schemaConversion` - gets JSON schema to form element conversion object

  * `valid` {`boolean`} - whether there are no errors

  * `disableAutofocus` {`boolean`} - Disables autofocus on fields.

  * `language` {`string`} - Language of the fields.

  * `resources` - resource link

  * `__formElements` - form elements by id and config data in schema

tags.name: simple-fields
tags.description:
`simple-fields`
Uses JSON Schema to display a series of fields

### Styling
`<simple-fields>` provides following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-margin` | vertical margin around container | 16px
`--simple-fields-margin-small` | smaller vertical margin above field itself | 8px
`--simple-fields-border-radus` | default border-radius | 2px
`--simple-fields-color` | text color | black
`--simple-fields-error-color` | error text color | #b40000
`--simple-fields-accent-color` | accent text/underline color | #3f51b5
`--simple-fields-border-color` | border-/underline color | #999
`--simple-fields-border-color-light` | used for range tracks | #ccc
`--simple-fields-faded-error-color` | used for range tracks | #ffc0c0

#### Field text
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-font-size` | font-size of field | 16px
`--simple-fields-font-family` | font-size of field | sans-serif
`--simple-fields-line-height` | line-height of field | 22px

#### Detail text
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-detail-font-size` | font-size of field details | 12px
`--simple-fields-detail-font-family` | font-size of field details | sans-serif
`--simple-fields-detail-line-height` | line-height of field details | 22px

#### Disabled Fields
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-disabled-color` | disabled text color | #999
`--simple-fields-disabled-opacity` | opacity for disabled field | 0.7

#### Radio Buttons and Checkboxes
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|--------
`--simple-fields-radio-option-display` | display label with field (flex) or above (block) | flex
`--simple-fields-radio-option-flex-wrap` | allow radio options to wrap to next line | wrap

### Configuring schemaConversion Property
You can customise elements from JSON schema conversion by setting `schemaConversion` property.
```
type: {                                       //For properties in "this.schema", define elements based on a property's "type"
object: {                                   //Defines element used when property's "type" is an "object"
  format: {                                 //Optional: define elements for "object" properties by "format"
    "tabs": {                               //Defines element used for object properties when "format" is "tabs"
      element: "a11y-tabs"                  //Element to create, eg. "paper-input", "select", "simple-fields-array", etc.
      descriptionProperty: "description"    //Optional: element's property that sets its description, e.g. "description"
      descriptionSlot: "description"        //Optional: element's slot that contains its description, e.g. "description"
      errorProperty: "error"                //Optional: element's property that sets its error status, e.g. "error"
      errorChangedProperty: "error"         //Optional: event element fires when error status changes, e.g. "error-changed"
      errorMessageProperty: "errorMessage"  //Optional: element's property that sets its error message, e.g. "errorMessage"
      errorMessageSlot: "errorMessage"      //Optional: element's slot that contains its error message, e.g. "errorMessage"
      labelProperty: "label"                //Optional: element's property that sets its label, e.g. "label"
      labelSlot: "label"                    //Optional: element's slot that contains its label, e.g. "label"
      valueProperty: "value"                //Optional: element's property that gets its value, e.g. "value" or "checked"
      setValueProperty: "value"             //Optional: element's property that sets its value, e.g. "value" or "checked" (default is same as valueProperty)
      valueChangedProperty: "value-changed" //Optional: event element fires when value property changes, e.g. "value-changed" or "click"
      valueSlot: ""                         //Optional: element's slot that's used to set its value, e.g. ""
      description: ""                       //Optional: element that contains description, e.g. "p", "span", "paper-tooltip", etc.
      child: {                              //Optional: child elements to be appended
        element: "a11y-tab"                 //Optional: type of child element, eg. "paper-input", "select", "simple-fields-array", etc.
        attributes: {                       //Optional: sets child element's attributes based on this.schemaConversion
          disabled: true                    //Example: sets disabled to true  
        } 
        properties: {                       //Optional: sets child element's attributes based on this.schema properties
          icon: "iconName"                  //Example: sets child element's icon property to this.schema property's iconName 
        }, 
        slots: {                            //Optional: inserts schema properties in child element's slots
          label: "label",                   //Example: places schema property's label into child element's label slot
          "": "description"                 //Example: places schema property's description into child element's unnamed slot
        } 
      },
      attributes: {},
      properties: {},
      slots: {}
    }
  },
  defaultSettings: {                        //Default element used for object properties
    element: ""
    label: ""
    description: ""     
    attributes: {}       
    properties: {}       
    slots: {}           
  }
}
}
``` 
### Configuring fieldsConversion Property
You can customise fields to JSON schema conversion by setting `fieldsConversion` property.
```
defaultSettings: {            //default JSON schema type if no type is matched
type: "string"              //sets JSON schema type to string
},
inputMethod: {                //for fields in "this.fields", define elements based on a property's "inputMethod"
colorpicker: {              //settings if inputMethod is color picker
  defaultSettings: {        //default colorpicker settings
    type: "string",         //sets JSON schema type to string
    format: "color"         //sets JSON schema format to color
  }
}
}
```

Events:

  * `active-tabs-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `fields` {`any[]`} - Fields to convert to JSON Schema.

  * `schematizer` - Conversion from fields array with inputMethods to JSON schema types and formats.
_See [Configuring fieldsConversion Property](configuring-the-fieldsconversion-property) above._

  * `label` {`string`} - Schema label

  * `active-path` - tracks all activeTabs as an object

  * `code-theme` {`string`} - default theme for code editor

  * `disable-responsive` {`boolean`} - 

Properties:

  * `fields` {`any[]`} - Fields to convert to JSON Schema.

_See [Configuring fieldsConversion Property](configuring-the-fieldsconversion-property) above._

  * `__activeTabs` - tracks all activeTabs as an object

`simple-icon-picker`
Uses simple-picker to create an icon picker

  * `keydown` {`CustomEvent<this>`} -

  * `change` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when options or value changes

  * `expand` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when listbox is expanded

  * `collapse` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when listbox is collapsed

Attributes:

  * `include-sets` {`any[]`} -

[
"editor:format-paint",
"content-copy",
"av:volume-off"

]```

  * `icons` {`any[]`} - An array of icons by name: ```
[
"editor:format-paint",
"content-copy",
"av:volume-off"

]```

  * `optionsPerRow` {`number`} - the maximum number of options per row

  * `hide-null-option` {`boolean`} - hide the null option
Default behavior/false will select first option and set value accordingly.

  * `justify` {`boolean`} - Box is 100% width of the ui

  * `__options` {`any[]`} - An array of options for picker, eg.: `
[
[
{
  "icon": "editor:format-paint",      //Optional. Used if picker is used as an icon picker.
  "alt": "Blue",                      //Required for accessibility. Alt text description of choice.
  "style": "background-color: blue;", //Optional. Used to set an option's style.
  ...                                 //Optional. Any other properties that should be captured as part of selected option's value
},...
]
]`

  * `allowNull` {`boolean`} - Allow a null option to be selected?

  * `align-right` {`boolean`} - Align right edges of listbox and button?
Default behavior/false aligns to left edges.

  * `aria-labelledby` {`string`} - Optional. Sets aria-labelledby attribute

  * `block-label` {`boolean`} - Position label above select dropdown?

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Is picker disabled?

  * `expanded` {`boolean`} - Is it expanded?

  * `hide-option-labels` {`boolean`} - Hide option labels? As color-picker or icon-picker, labels may be redundant.
This option would move labels off-screen so that only screen-readers will have them.

  * `hide-sample` {`boolean`} - Hide selected item sample?
Default behavior/false shows a sample without expanding menu.

  * `label` {`string`} - Optional. Label for picker input

  * `__ready` {`boolean`} - 

  * `options` {`never[]`} - An array of options for picker, eg.: 
[
[
{
  "icon": "editor:format-paint",      //Optional. Used if picker is used as an icon picker.
  "alt": "Blue",                      //Required for accessibility. Alt text description of choice.
  "style": "background-color: blue;", //Optional. Used to set an option's style.
  ...                                 //Optional. Any other properties that should be captured as part of selected option's value
},...
]
]

  * `title-as-html` {`boolean`} - Renders html as title. (Good for titles with HTML in them.)

  * `value` {`string`} - The value of the option.

  * `__activeDesc` {`string`} - Aria-activedescendant attribute (active option's ID)

  * `__selectedOption` - Selected option based on value of picker

Events:

  * `changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - Fires when properties change

  * `click` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - handles listbox click event

  * `mousedown` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires with listbox mousedown event

  * `keydown` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

  * `option-focus` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when active descendant changes

  * `value-changed` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when value changes

  * `change` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when options or value changes

  * `expand` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when listbox is expanded

  * `collapse` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - fires when listbox is collapsed

Attributes:

  * `emoji-types` {`any[]`} - emoji types to include

  * `element-visible` {`boolean`} - 

  * `hide-null-option` {`boolean`} - hide the null option
Default behavior/false will select first option and set value accordingly.

  * `justify` {`boolean`} - Box is 100% width of the ui

  * `__options` {`any[]`} - An array of options for picker, eg.: `
[
[
{
  "icon": "editor:format-paint",      //Optional. Used if picker is used as an icon picker.
  "alt": "Blue",                      //Required for accessibility. Alt text description of choice.
  "style": "background-color: blue;", //Optional. Used to set an option's style.
  ...                                 //Optional. Any other properties that should be captured as part of selected option's value
},...
]
]`

  * `allow-null` {`boolean`} - allow a null value?
Default behavior/false will select first option and set value accordingly.

  * `align-right` {`boolean`} - Align right edges of listbox and button?
Default behavior/false aligns to left edges.

  * `aria-labelledby` {`string`} - Optional. Sets aria-labelledby attribute

  * `block-label` {`boolean`} - Position label above select dropdown?

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - Is picker disabled?

  * `expanded` {`boolean`} - Is it expanded?

  * `hide-option-labels` {`boolean`} - Hide option labels? As color-picker or icon-picker, labels may be redundant.
This option would move labels off-screen so that only screen-readers will have them.

  * `hide-sample` {`boolean`} - Hide selected item sample?
Default behavior/false shows a sample without expanding menu.

  * `label` {`string`} - Optional. Label for picker input

  * `__ready` {`boolean`} - 

  * `options` {`any[]`} - An array of options for picker, eg.:

{
  "icon": "editor:format-paint",      //Optional. Used if picker is used as an icon picker.

  "style": "background-color: blue;", //Optional. Used to set an option's style.
  ...                                 //Optional. Any other properties that should be captured as part of selected option's value
},...
]
]

  * `title-as-html` {`boolean`} - Renders html as title. (Good for titles with HTML in them.)

  * `value` {`string`} - An string that stores current value for picker

  * `__activeDesc` {`string`} - Aria-activedescendant attribute (active option's ID)

  * `__selectedOption` - Selected option based on value of picker

`--simple-picker-option-size` | size of each simple picker option | 24px

  * `styles` - styles object to allow for piercing of shadow DOM

  * `title-as-html` {`boolean`} - Renders html as title. (Good for titles with HTML in them.)

  * `value` {`string`} - The value of the option.

tags.name: simple-popover
tags.description:
`simple-popover`
a popover alertdialog that is positioned next to a target element

### Styling

`<simple-popover>` provides the following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--simple-popover-border-radius` | popover border-radius | 3px
`--simple-popover-color` | popover text color| #222
`--simple-popover-padding` | popover padding | 10px
`--simple-popover-background-color` | popover background-color | white
`--simple-popover-border-color` | popover border-color | #bbb
`--simple-popover-box-shadow` | popover box-shadow | rgba(60, 64, 67, 0.3) 0px 4px 8px 3px;

Attributes:

  * `allow-overlap` {`boolean`} - Element has absolututely positioned children, such as menus
and tooltips that are allowed to overlap the target

  * `position-align` {`string`} - Aligns at the start, or end fo target. Default is centered.

  * `justify` {`boolean`} - 

  * `auto` {`boolean`} - Element is positioned from connected to disconnected?
Otherwise setPosition and unsetPosition must be called manually.

  * `fit-to-visible-bounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `target` - The actual target element

  * `sticky` {`boolean`} - Stays on screen while target is on screen

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `__positions` - The element's style

Properties:

  * `allowOverlap` {`boolean`} - Element has absolututely positioned children, such as menus
and tooltips that are allowed to overlap the target

  * `positionAlign` {`string`} - Aligns at the start, or end fo target. Default is centered.

  * `justify` {`boolean`} - 

  * `_ticking` {`boolean`} - 

  * `scrollTarget` - 

  * `auto` {`boolean`} - Element is positioned from connected to disconnected?
Otherwise setPosition and unsetPosition must be called manually.

  * `fitToVisibleBounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `target` - The actual target element

  * `sticky` {`boolean`} - Stays on screen while target is on screen

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `__positions` - The element's style

  * `__observe` {`boolean`} -

tags.name: simple-popover
tags.description:
`simple-popover`
a popover alertdialog that is positioned next to a target element

### Styling

`<simple-popover>` provides the following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--simple-popover-border-radius` | popover border-radius | 3px
`--simple-popover-color` | popover text color| #222
`--simple-popover-padding` | popover padding | 10px
`--simple-popover-background-color` | popover background-color | white
`--simple-popover-border-color` | popover border-color | #bbb
`--simple-popover-box-shadow` | popover box-shadow | rgba(60, 64, 67, 0.3) 0px 4px 8px 3px;

Attributes:

  * `allow-overlap` {`boolean`} - Element has absolututely positioned children, such as menus
and tooltips that are allowed to overlap the target

  * `position-align` {`string`} - Aligns at the start, or end fo target. Default is centered.

  * `justify` {`boolean`} - 

  * `auto` {`boolean`} - Element is positioned from connected to disconnected?
Otherwise setPosition and unsetPosition must be called manually.

  * `fit-to-visible-bounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `target` - The actual target element

  * `sticky` {`boolean`} - Stays on screen while target is on screen

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `__positions` - The element's style

Properties:

  * `allowOverlap` {`boolean`} - Element has absolututely positioned children, such as menus
and tooltips that are allowed to overlap the target

  * `positionAlign` {`string`} - Aligns at the start, or end fo target. Default is centered.

  * `justify` {`boolean`} - 

  * `_ticking` {`boolean`} - 

  * `scrollTarget` - 

  * `auto` {`boolean`} - Element is positioned from connected to disconnected?
Otherwise setPosition and unsetPosition must be called manually.

  * `fitToVisibleBounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `target` - The actual target element

  * `sticky` {`boolean`} - Stays on screen while target is on screen

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `__positions` - The element's style

  * `__observe` {`boolean`} -

  * `selector` {`string`} - limits search to within target's elements that match a selectgor

  * `__hideNext` {`boolean`} - Hide next button

`simple-toast`
`A singular toast / message for conistency`

Attributes:

  * `opened` {`boolean`} - Opened state of the toast, use event to change

  * `text` {`string`} - Plain text based message to display

  * `class-style` {`string`} - Class name, fit-bottom being a useful one

  * `close-text` {`string`} - Text for the close button

  * `duration` {`number`} - How long the toast message should be displayed

  * `event-callback` {`string`} - Event callback when hide is called

  * `close-button` {`boolean`} - If there should be a close button shown

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - a selected accent-"color": grey, red, pink, purple, etc.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - make the default theme dark?

for styling:

--simple-toolbar-border-width | default border width | 1px
--simple-toolbar-group-border-color | border color for button groups | --simple-toolbar-border-color
--simple-toolbar-group-border-width | border width for button groups | --simple-toolbar-border-width
--simple-toolbar-group-padding | padding for button groups | 0 3px

tags.name: simple-toolbar
tags.description:
`simple-toolbar`
a customizable toolbar

### Styling

`<simple-toolbar>` provides following custom properties and mixins
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
--simple-toolbar-border-color | default border color | transparent
--simple-toolbar-border-width | default border width | 1px
--simple-toolbar-group-border-color | border color for button groups | --simple-toolbar-border-color
--simple-toolbar-group-border-width | border width for button groups | --simple-toolbar-border-width
--simple-toolbar-group-padding | padding for button groups | 0 3px

Events:

  * `shortcut-key-pressed` {`CustomEvent<any>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `always-expanded` {`boolean`} - always expanded so more button is unnecessary?

  * `aria-controls` {`string`} - id of element controlled by toolbar

  * `aria-label` {`string`} - label for the toolbar

  * `id` {`string`} - unique id

  * `more-shortcuts` - Optional space-separated list of keyboard shortcuts for editor
to fire this button, see iron-a11y-keys for more info.

  * `collapsed` {`boolean`} - is toolbar collapsed?

  * `collapse-disabled` {`boolean`} - whether there is no need to collapse

  * `config` {`any[]`} - Custom configuration of toolbar groups and buttons.
(See default value for example using default configuration.)

  * `__buttons` {`any[]`} - raw array of buttons

  * `__focused` {`boolean`} - whether toolbar has focus

  * `__hovered` {`boolean`} - whether toolbar is hovered

  * `sticky` {`boolean`} - Should toolbar stick to top so that it is always visible?

  * `shortcut-keys` - Optional space-sperated list of keyboard shortcuts for editor
to fire this button, see iron-a11y-keys for more info.

Properties:

  * `alwaysExpanded` {`boolean`} - always expanded so more button is unnecessary?

  * `ariaControls` {`string`} - id of element controlled by toolbar

  * `ariaLabel` {`string`} - label for the toolbar

  * `id` {`string`} - unique id

  * `moreShortcuts` - Optional space-separated list of keyboard shortcuts for editor
to fire this button, see iron-a11y-keys for more info.

tags.name: simple-tooltip
tags.description:
`simple-tooltip`
`a simple tooltip forked from paper-tooltip with the same api minus apply removal`
  ### Styling
  The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling:

  Custom property | Description | Default
  ----------------|-------------|----------
  `--simple-tooltip-background` | The background color of the tooltip | `#616161`
  `--simple-tooltip-opacity` | The opacity of the tooltip | `0.9`
  `--simple-tooltip-text-color` | The text color of the tooltip | `white`
  `--simple-tooltip-delay-in` | Delay before tooltip starts to fade in | `500`
  `--simple-tooltip-delay-out` | Delay before tooltip starts to fade out | `0`
  `--simple-tooltip-duration-in` | Timing for animation when showing tooltip | `500`
  `--simple-tooltip-duration-out` | Timing for animation when hiding tooltip | `0`

Attributes:

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `animation-delay` {`number`} - The delay that will be applied before the `entry` animation is
played when showing the tooltip.

  * `_showing` {`boolean`} - 

  * `manual-mode` {`boolean`} - Set this to true if you want to manually control when the tooltip
is shown or hidden.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `fit-to-visible-bounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `margin-top` {`number`} - This property is deprecated, but left over so that it doesn't
break exiting code. Please use `offset` instead. If both `offset` and
`marginTop` are provided, `marginTop` will be ignored.

  * `animation-entry` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on entry.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animation-exit` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on exit.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

Properties:

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `animationDelay` {`number`} - The delay that will be applied before the `entry` animation is
played when showing the tooltip.

  * `_showing` {`boolean`} - 

  * `target` {Node} - Returns the target element that this tooltip is anchored to. It is
either the element given by the `for` attribute, or the immediate parent
of the tooltip.

  * `manualMode` {`boolean`} - Set this to true if you want to manually control when the tooltip
is shown or hidden.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `fitToVisibleBounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `marginTop` {`number`} - This property is deprecated, but left over so that it doesn't
break exiting code. Please use `offset` instead. If both `offset` and
`marginTop` are provided, `marginTop` will be ignored.

  * `animationEntry` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on entry.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animationExit` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on exit.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animationConfig` -

tags.name: simple-tooltip
tags.description:
`simple-tooltip`
`a simple tooltip forked from paper-tooltip with the same api minus apply removal`
  ### Styling
  The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling:

  Custom property | Description | Default
  ----------------|-------------|----------
  `--simple-tooltip-background` | The background color of the tooltip | `#616161`
  `--simple-tooltip-opacity` | The opacity of the tooltip | `0.9`
  `--simple-tooltip-text-color` | The text color of the tooltip | `white`
  `--simple-tooltip-delay-in` | Delay before tooltip starts to fade in | `500`
  `--simple-tooltip-delay-out` | Delay before tooltip starts to fade out | `0`
  `--simple-tooltip-duration-in` | Timing for animation when showing tooltip | `500`
  `--simple-tooltip-duration-out` | Timing for animation when hiding tooltip | `0`

Attributes:

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `animation-delay` {`number`} - The delay that will be applied before the `entry` animation is
played when showing the tooltip.

  * `_showing` {`boolean`} - 

  * `manual-mode` {`boolean`} - Set this to true if you want to manually control when the tooltip
is shown or hidden.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `fit-to-visible-bounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `margin-top` {`number`} - This property is deprecated, but left over so that it doesn't
break exiting code. Please use `offset` instead. If both `offset` and
`marginTop` are provided, `marginTop` will be ignored.

  * `animation-entry` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on entry.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animation-exit` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on exit.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

Properties:

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `animationDelay` {`number`} - The delay that will be applied before the `entry` animation is
played when showing the tooltip.

  * `_showing` {`boolean`} - 

  * `target` {Node} - Returns the target element that this tooltip is anchored to. It is
either the element given by the `for` attribute, or the immediate parent
of the tooltip.

  * `manualMode` {`boolean`} - Set this to true if you want to manually control when the tooltip
is shown or hidden.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `fitToVisibleBounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `marginTop` {`number`} - This property is deprecated, but left over so that it doesn't
break exiting code. Please use `offset` instead. If both `offset` and
`marginTop` are provided, `marginTop` will be ignored.

  * `animationEntry` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on entry.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animationExit` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on exit.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animationConfig` -

tags.name: social-share-link
tags.description:
`social-share-link`
`a link to share content on social`

Attributes:

  * `__href` {`string`} - the href for the link

  * `__icon` {`string`} - the icon name for the link

  * `__linkText` {`string`} - the link text specified, or the default link text

  * `__showIcon` {`boolean`} - 

  * `button-style` {`boolean`} - display link as a button

  * `image` {`string`} - optional image to attach to the share
(Pinterest only)

  * `message` {`string`} - the message to attach to the social share
(not used in Facebook)

  * `mode` {`string`} - optional display mode for the link,"text-only" or "icon-only";
default is to dislay both an icon and text

  * `text` {`string`} - the link text; if null, the text will be "Share on (type of social)"

  * `type` {`string`} - the type of social; currently supports
Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest, and Twitter (default)

  * `url` {`string`} - the url to share

tags.name: threaded-discussion-form
tags.description:
`threaded-discussion-form`
a threaded discussions component for elms-ln

### Styling

`<threaded-discussion-form>` provides the following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--threaded-discussion-button-BorderRadius` | border-radius for all buttons | 3px
`--threaded-discussion-button-FontWeight` | default button font-weight | 
`--threaded-discussion-button-FontSize` | default button line-height | var(--threaded-discussion-FontSize, 14px));
`--threaded-discussion-button-FontFamily` | default button font-family |
`--threaded-discussion-reply-button-Color` | text color for reply button | #4b4b4b
`--threaded-discussion-reply-button-BackgroundColor` | background color for reply button | #fff
`--threaded-discussion-reply-button-BorderColor` | border color for reply button | #4b4b4b
`--threaded-discussion-reply-button-focus-Color` | text color for reply button when focused | #222
`--threaded-discussion-reply-button-focus-BackgroundColor` | background color for reply button when focused | #fff
`--threaded-discussion-reply-button-focus-BorderColor` | border color for reply button when focused | #222
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-Color` | text color for reply button | #fff
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-BackgroundColor` | background color for reply button | #4b4b4b
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-BorderColor` | border color for reply button | #4b4b4b
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-focus-Color` | text color for reply button when focused | #fff
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-focus-BackgroundColor` | background color for reply button when focused | #222
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-focus-BorderColor` | border color for reply button when focused | #222
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-FontWeight` | overrides default button font-weight for comment button | 
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-FontSize` | overrides default default button line-height for comment button |
`--threaded-discussion-comment-button-FontFamily` | overrides default default button font-family for comment button |
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-Height` | height of textarea when form is NOT focused | 16px
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-Opacity` | opacity of textarea when form is NT focused | 0
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-focus-Height` | height of textarea when form is focused | 100px
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-focus-Opacity` | opacity of textarea when form is focused | 1
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-Color` | textarea text color | var(--threaded-discussion-Color, #4b4b4b));
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-LineHeight` | textarea line-height | var(--threaded-discussion-LineHeight, 160%));
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-FontWeight` | textarea font-weight | 
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-FontSize` | textarea line-height | var(--threaded-discussion-FontSize, 14px));
`--threaded-discussion-textarea-FontFamily` | textarea font-family | var(--threaded-discussion-FontFamily));

Events:

  * `comment-demo` {`CustomEvent<{ textarea: HTMLTextAreaElement | null; thread: any; }>`} - 

  * `comment-submitted` {`CustomEvent<this>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `button` {`string`} - reply button id

  * `button-label` {`string`} - label for button

  * `demo` {`boolean`} - whetherin demo mode

  * `field` {`string`} - field name for comment body

  * `icon` {`string`} - button icon

  * `submit` {`string`} - form action on submit

  * `textarea-label` {`string`} - label for textarea

  * `thread` {`string`} - thread id if this form is replying to a thread

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - whether form is disabled

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - whether form is hidden

Properties:

  * `button` {`string`} - reply button id

  * `buttonLabel` {`string`} - label for button

  * `demo` {`boolean`} - whetherin demo mode

  * `field` {`string`} - field name for comment body

  * `icon` {`string`} - button icon

  * `submit` {`string`} - form action on submit

  * `textareaLabel` {`string`} - label for textarea

  * `thread` {`string`} - thread id if this form is replying to a thread

  * `disabled` {`boolean`} - whether form is disabled

  * `hidden` {`boolean`} - whether form is hidden
