tags.name: threaded-discussion
tags.description:
`threaded-discussion`
a threaded discussions component

### Styling

`<threaded-discussion>` provides the following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--threaded-discussion-FontSize` | default font-size | 14px
`--threaded-discussion-LineHeight` | default line-height | 160%
`--threaded-discussion-Color` | default text color | #95989a
`--threaded-discussion-threads-BackgroundColor` | default thread backbround-color | #eaeaea
`--threaded-discussion-threads-Margin` | default thread margin | 0
`--threaded-discussion-thread-focus-BorderLeft` | default thread border left color when commenting | 4px solid blue
`--threaded-discussion-new-thread-BackgroundColor` | overrides default thread backbround-color for new thread | var(--threaded-discussion-threads-BackgroundColor, #eaeaea)
`--threaded-discussion-new-thread-Margin` | overrides default thread margin for new thread | var(--threaded-discussion-threads-Margin, 0))
`--threaded-discussion-new-thread-focus-BorderLeft` | overrides default border left color when posting a new thread | 
`--threaded-discussion-comment-BackgroundColor` | comment bacground color | #fff
`--threaded-discussion-comment-Padding` | comment padding | 10px
`--threaded-discussion-reply-indent` | left-indent for thread replies | calc(2 * var(--threaded-discussion-comment-Padding,10px))));
`--threaded-discussion-name-FontSize` | comment author name font-size | calc(1.1 * var(--threaded-discussion-FontSize, 14px)));
`--threaded-discussion-name-FontWeight` | comment author name font-weight | bold;
`--threaded-discussion-name-FontFamily` | overrides default font-family for comment author name | 
`--threaded-discussion-name-Color` | comment author name text color | #4b4b4b);
`--threaded-discussion-date-FontSize` | comment author name font-size | calc(0.8 * var(--threaded-discussion-FontSize, 14px)));
`--threaded-discussion-date-FontWeight` | comment author name font-weight | normal
`--threaded-discussion-date-FontFamily` | overrides default font-family for comment date | 
`--threaded-discussion-date-Color` | comment date text color | #95989a));

Attributes:

  * `comment-button-label` {`string`} - label for comment submit button

  * `comment-textarea-label` {`string`} - label for comment textarea

  * `comment-icon` {`string`} - optional icon for comment button

  * `loading-text` {`string`} - text that displays while discussion data loads

  * `relative-dates` {`boolean`} - display dates in terms of "ago" or "from now"

  * `reply-button-label` {`string`} - label for reply submit button

  * `reply-textarea-label` {`string`} - label for reply textarea

  * `reply-icon` {`string`} - icon for reply submit button

  * `source` {`string`} - path (without parameters) for fetching data

  * `latest` {`boolean`} - sort comments latest-first

  * `data` - raw data, can be Object or Array

  * `dateLocale` {`string`} - locale for date formatting

  * `dateFormat` - JS format object for dates

  * `demo` {`boolean`} - discussion in demo mode?
Instead of submitting,
submission is temporarily inserted into data.

  * `map` - object that will reformat data,
where key is final formatted property,
and value is raw data property to map.
Example: {avatar: "image"}

tags.name: threaded-discussion
tags.description:
`threaded-discussion`
a threaded discussions component

### Styling

`<threaded-discussion>` provides the following custom properties
for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--threaded-discussion-FontSize` | default font-size | 14px
`--threaded-discussion-LineHeight` | default line-height | 160%
`--threaded-discussion-Color` | default text color | #95989a
`--threaded-discussion-threads-BackgroundColor` | default thread backbround-color | #eaeaea
`--threaded-discussion-threads-Margin` | default thread margin | 0
`--threaded-discussion-thread-focus-BorderLeft` | default thread border left color when commenting | 4px solid blue
`--threaded-discussion-new-thread-BackgroundColor` | overrides default thread backbround-color for new thread | var(--threaded-discussion-threads-BackgroundColor, #eaeaea)
`--threaded-discussion-new-thread-Margin` | overrides default thread margin for new thread | var(--threaded-discussion-threads-Margin, 0))
`--threaded-discussion-new-thread-focus-BorderLeft` | overrides default border left color when posting a new thread | 
`--threaded-discussion-comment-BackgroundColor` | comment bacground color | #fff
`--threaded-discussion-comment-Padding` | comment padding | 10px
`--threaded-discussion-reply-indent` | left-indent for thread replies | calc(2 * var(--threaded-discussion-comment-Padding,10px))));
`--threaded-discussion-name-FontSize` | comment author name font-size | calc(1.1 * var(--threaded-discussion-FontSize, 14px)));
`--threaded-discussion-name-FontWeight` | comment author name font-weight | bold;
`--threaded-discussion-name-FontFamily` | overrides default font-family for comment author name | 
`--threaded-discussion-name-Color` | comment author name text color | #4b4b4b);
`--threaded-discussion-date-FontSize` | comment author name font-size | calc(0.8 * var(--threaded-discussion-FontSize, 14px)));
`--threaded-discussion-date-FontWeight` | comment author name font-weight | normal
`--threaded-discussion-date-FontFamily` | overrides default font-family for comment date | 
`--threaded-discussion-date-Color` | comment date text color | #95989a));

Attributes:

  * `comment-button-label` {`string`} - label for comment submit button

  * `comment-textarea-label` {`string`} - label for comment textarea

  * `comment-icon` {`string`} - optional icon for comment button

  * `loading-text` {`string`} - text that displays while discussion data loads

  * `relative-dates` {`boolean`} - display dates in terms of "ago" or "from now"

  * `reply-button-label` {`string`} - label for reply submit button

  * `reply-textarea-label` {`string`} - label for reply textarea

  * `reply-icon` {`string`} - icon for reply submit button

  * `source` {`string`} - path (without parameters) for fetching data

  * `latest` {`boolean`} - sort comments latest-first

  * `data` - raw data, can be Object or Array

  * `dateLocale` {`string`} - locale for date formatting

  * `dateFormat` - JS format object for dates

  * `demo` {`boolean`} - discussion in demo mode?
Instead of submitting,
submission is temporarily inserted into data.

  * `map` - object that will reformat data,
where key is final formatted property,
and value is raw data property to map.
Example: {avatar: "image"}
would use raw data's image property as a avatar

tags.name: video-player
tags.description:
`video-player`
`A simple responsive video player with ridiculously powerful backing`

Attributes:

  * `height` {`string`} - Height of media player.

  * `id` {`string`} - Unique id

  * `media-title` {`string`} - Simple caption for video

  * `track` {`string`} - Url for a single subtitle track

  * `thumbnail-src` {`string`} - Source of optional thumbnail image

  * `width` {`string`} - Width of media player for non-a11y-media.

  * `sourceData` - Source properties and slotted sources

  * `sourceType` {`string`} - 

  * `crossorigin` {`string`} - Cross origin flag for transcripts to load

  * `darkTranscript` {`boolean`} - Use dark theme on transcript? Default is false, even when player is dark.

  * `disableInteractive` {`boolean`} - disable interactive mode that makes transcript clickable

  * `hide-timestamps` {`boolean`} - show cue's start and end time

  * `hide-transcript` {`boolean`} - Hide transcript by default

  * `hide-youtube-link` {`boolean`} - Open on YouTube button

  * `lang` {`string`} - Language of media

  * `playing` {`boolean`} - Data reactivity for play status from a11y-media-player

  * `allow-background-play` {`boolean`} - Option to allow playing while not active tab

  * `learning-mode` {`boolean`} - Learning mode

  * `linkable` {`boolean`} - Include a share link?

  * `sources` {`any[]`} - Array of multiple video sources

  * `sticky-corner` {`string`} - When playing but scrolled off screen, to which corner does it "stick":
`top-left`, `top-right`, `bottom-left`, `bottom-right`, or `none`?
Default is `top-right`. `None` disables stickiness.

  * `tracks` {`any[]`} - Array of text tracks, eg. `[{ "src": "path/to/track.vtt", "label": "English", "srclang": "en", "kind": "subtitles", }]`

  * `source` {`string`} - Single sources of video

  * `element-visible` {`boolean`} - 

  * `schemaMap` - Schema Map for the element, used to generate a valid prefix on the fly
Props set for Polymer compatibility

  * `t` - 

  * `accent-color` {`string`} - Optional accent color for controls,
using these colors:
`red`, `pink`, `purple`, `deep-purple`, `indigo`, `blue`,
`light-blue`, `cyan`, `teal`, `green`, `light-green`, `lime`,
`yellow`, `amber`, orange, deep-orange, and brown.
Default is null.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - Enables darker player.

Properties:

  * `height` {`string`} - Height of media player.

  * `id` {`string`} - Unique id

  * `mediaTitle` {`string`} - Simple caption for video

  * `track` {`string`} - Url for a single subtitle track

  * `thumbnailSrc` {`string`} - Source of optional thumbnail image

  * `width` {`string`} - Width of media player for non-a11y-media.

  * `html5` - gets the HTML5 `audio` or `video` children

  * `iframed` {`boolean`} - Computes whether uses iframe

  * `isA11yMedia` {`boolean`} - Determines if compatible with `a11y-media-player`

  * `observer` - mutation observer for tabs

  * `sandboxed` {`boolean`} - Compute sandboxed status

  * `sourceProperties` {`any[]`} - Gets cleaned source list from source and sources properties

  * `trackProperties` {`any[]`} - Gets cleaned track list from track and tracks properties

  * `sourceData` - Source properties and slotted sources

  * `audioOnly` {`boolean`} - 

  * `standAlone` {`boolean`} - 

  * `trackData` {`any[]`} - Gets cleaned track list

  * `youtubeId` {`string`} - Gets Youtube ID from source string

  * `playerId` {`string`} - gets an id for a11y-media-player

  * `currentTime` - mapping down into the shadowRoot element bc these are common things to want to know

  * `windowControllers` - 

  * `sourceType` {`string`} - 

  * `crossorigin` {`string`} - Cross origin flag for transcripts to load

  * `darkTranscript` {`boolean`} - Use dark theme on transcript? Default is false, even when player is dark.

  * `disableInteractive` {`boolean`} - disable interactive mode that makes transcript clickable

  * `hideTimestamps` {`boolean`} - show cue's start and end time

  * `hideTranscript` {`boolean`} - Hide transcript by default

  * `hideYoutubeLink` {`boolean`} - Open on YouTube button

  * `lang` {`string`} - Language of media

  * `playing` {`boolean`} - Data reactivity for play status from a11y-media-player

  * `__setVisChange` {`boolean`} - 

  * `allowBackgroundPlay` {`boolean`} - Option to allow playing while not active tab

  * `learningMode` {`boolean`} - Learning mode

  * `linkable` {`boolean`} - Include a share link?

  * `sources` {`any[]`} - Array of multiple video sources

  * `stickyCorner` {`string`} - When playing but scrolled off screen, to which corner does it "stick":
`top-left`, `top-right`, `bottom-left`, `bottom-right`, or `none`?
Default is `top-right`. `None` disables stickiness.

  * `tracks` {`any[]`} - Array of text tracks, eg. `[{ "src": "path/to/track.vtt", "label": "English", "srclang": "en", "kind": "subtitles", }]`

  * `source` {`string`} - Single sources of video

  * `elementVisible` {`boolean`} - 

  * `IOThresholds` {`number[]`} - 

  * `IORootMargin` {`string`} - 

  * `IOVisibleLimit` {`number`} - 

  * `IORemoveOnVisible` {`boolean`} - 

  * `IODelay` {`number`} - 

  * `IORoot` - 

  * `schemaResourceID` {`string`} - 

  * `schemaMap` - Schema Map for the element, used to generate a valid prefix on the fly
Props set for Polymer compatibility

  * `t` -

using these colors:
`red`, `pink`, `purple`, `deep-purple`, `indigo`, `blue`,
`light-blue`, `cyan`, `teal`, `green`, `light-green`, `lime`,
`yellow`, `amber`, orange, deep-orange, and brown.
Default is null.

  * `dark` {`boolean`} - Enables darker player.

tags.name: wysiwyg-hax

`wysiwyg-hax`
`Integration of wysiwyg edit form for a page with HAX.`

Events:

  * `hax-save` {`CustomEvent<any>`} - 

  * `simple-modal-hide` {`CustomEvent<{}>`} - 

Attributes:

  * `hide-panel-ops` {`boolean`} - Hide the panel operations (save and cancel),

  * `offset-margin` {`string`} - 

  * `body-value` {`string`} - Data binding of a hidden text area with the value from the hax-body tag

  * `app-store-connection` {`string`} - Connection object for talking to an app store.

  * `saveButtonSelector` - Object reference that will get clicked on

  * `field-class` {`string`} - class on the field

  * `sync-body` {`boolean`} - 

  * `open-default` {`boolean`} - Default the panel to open

  * `element-align` {`string`} - Direction to align the hax edit panel

  * `field-id` {`string`} - fieldId, id value on the input field.

  * `field-name` {`string`} - fieldName, internal to the form in whatever system it's in.

  * `end-point` {`string`} - Location to save content to.

  * `allowed-tags` {`any[]`} - allowed Tags, usually as dictated by the input filtering
layer of the backend system that HAX is riding on.
While not fullproof, this at least will enforce front-end
filtering to match what actually is going to be allowed
to be saved in the first place.

  * `redirect-location` {`string`} - 

  * `update-page-data` {`string`} - Page data, body of text as a string.

Properties:

  * `hidePanelOps` {`boolean`} - Hide the panel operations (save and cancel),

  * `appStoreConnection` {`string`} - Connection object for talking to an app store.

  * `saveButtonSelector` - Object reference that will get clicked on

  * `fieldClass` {`string`} - class on the field

  * `syncBody` {`boolean`} - 

  * `windowControllers` - 

  * `openDefault` {`boolean`} - Default the panel to open

  * `elementAlign` {`string`} - Direction to align the hax edit panel

  * `fieldId` {`string`} - fieldId, id value on the input field.

  * `fieldName` {`string`} - fieldName, internal to the form in whatever system it's in.

  * `endPoint` {`string`} - Location to save content to.

  * `allowedTags` {`any[]`} - allowed Tags, usually as dictated by the input filtering
layer of the backend system that HAX is riding on.
While not fullproof, this at least will enforce front-end
filtering to match what actually is going to be allowed
to be saved in the first place.

  * `redirectLocation` {`string`} - 

  * `updatePageData` {`string`} - Page data, body of text as a string.
